improvement_complement: Improvements that provide additional stone or bonuses when taking clay from accumulation spaces.
text: Whenever you use a person to take Clay from a Building resource Accumulation space, you may also receive 1 Stone. In Round 9 or before, if there are 3 or more Clay on the space, you must leave 1 Clay on the space to receive the Stone.
Whenever you pay Food to play an Occupation or a Minor Improvement, you may pay up to 2 Food less.
If you play this Minor Improvement on the "Starting player" Action space, instead of taking Starting player, you may take a "Family growth" action. You must have room in your home.

improvement_complement: Family growth-related improvements or those that provide food bonuses for the "Family growth" action.
text: Whenever another player performs a "Family growth" action, you may place 1 Food from the supply on this card. Once during a 3/4/5 player game, you may pay 3/4/5 Food from this card to play your next "Family growth" action as "Family growth even without room".

The player on you left chooses 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Place 1 Wood from the general supply on this space. It counts as used and you can not build anything on it. (In a Solo game randomly choose a space.)
When you play this card, you get 1 Bonus point per complete Round left to be played. You cannot use any more Renovation actions.

Whenever you build a Room or Renovate your home, you may receive 1 Negative point instead of paying the required 1 or 2 Reed. In a 2 or 3 player game, you may only play this Minor Improvement on the "1 Major or Minor Improvement" Action space.

Place 5 Food from the general Supply on the Styrian Oak. At the start of each Round, you can return 1 Food to the general Supply. Once during the game, at any time, you can pay the number of Food (0 to 5) remaining on the Styrian Oak to receive 6 Wood from the Supply.
Each work phase, you can place a(nother) person on the first non-accumulating action space used by any player (including you), as long as there is only 1 person on that space.

Once during the game, when you have at least 1 Food, 1 Grain, and 1 Vegetable in your personal supply and 1 Sheep and 1 Wild boar on your farmyard, you may choose to not place any people in a round and instead receive 7 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide immediate grain gains or bonuses for adjacency to certain actions.
text: Whenever you use an Action space orthogonally adjacent to an occupied "Family growth" Action space from stage 2 or stage 5, you receive 1 Grain immediately before.

You can't Bake bread with the Grain Mill Oven. Clay and Stone Ovens are Minor Improvements for you. You may discard this instead of paying an Oven's cost. When you play this card, you can immediately take the "Bake bread" action.
Once each round, whenever you have no Food in your personal supply, you receive 1 Food.
Your remaining Family members leave the house and flee to different unused Action spaces on a single game board that is not occupied by your first person. Take those actions immediately in any order.

insight: Well, it's free, and you can't argue with that. Still, most of the time you don't end up eating vegetables, as they're too valuable in terms of points and come at an awkward stage in the game. Clearly if you plan on eating vegetables, this is a must-play. If you're not sure one way or the other, the fact that it's free means that either way it won't be too big of a mistake.
text: Whenever you convert Vegetables to Food using a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth or Cooking Corner, you receive 1 additional Food.
Each work phase, if the last action space you use is an accumulation space, you can immediately afterward take a "Bake Bread" action.
This card is a field that you can sow in, an occupation, and the "Fireplace" major improvement with all of its effects. You can play it only via a "Minor Improvement" action.
Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you can take a "Build Fences" action instead of one of the two actions provide by the action space.
You can build the "Joinery" and "Well" major improvement even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action, or you can build both with a single "Major Improvement" action.
You immediately receive 1 Wood for every Unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your home.
Place 3 Clay and 2 Stone from the supply on this card. At the end of each round, you may pay 2 Food to receive 1 of these resources. Once this card is empty, it provides room for 1 Family member.

improvement_complement: Fencing-related improvements or those that grant points for building fences.
text: Whenever you build fences, you receive 1 Bonus point. When you play this card, you may immediately build fences.
As soon as you use the Round space with the number that is equal to the total number of Wood in your supply, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply afterwards.

insight: First off, almost no one buys a Joinery, making a card that enhances it automatically dubious in value. Second, even if you have the Joinery somehow, the card costs 1W! Since each wood is worth 2 food, you won't actually be profiting from the card until you use the Joinery 3 times. If you actually plan on using the Joinery 3 times, the question becomes: where are you getting all this extra wood, and why are you not using it for room extension/fencing?
text: Whenever you turn 1 Wood into Food using the Joinery, Sawmill or Cabinetmaker, you receive 1 additional Food. You can choose instead to turn a second Wood into exactly 2 Food.
Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action on an Action space, you may also exchange 1 Grain for 1 Guest token to place in the same round. (Return the Guest token after using.)

At the end of an Action, whenever you have 0 of exactly one of the goods shown below (G V W C R S), take 1 of that good from the general supply. You cannot convert goods to Food if you have exactly 1 of this good.
You can build the major improvements "Joinery", "Pottery", and "Basketmaker's Workshop" even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action. They each cost you 1 stone less.
Whenever you play another Minor Improvement, you receive 1 Grain afterward.

Once during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you can place 1 Wood from your supply on 1/2 orthogonally adjacent (revealed or unrevealed) Action spaces (to the used plow space) to Plow 1/2 additional fields.

improvement_complement: Room building enhancements or improvements that provide resource savings for home expansion.
text: At the start of round 6/10/13, you may (before phase 1) build 1 Wooden/ Clay/ Stone room if your home is made of the same material. Pay 1 less Clay for the Clay room and 2 less Stone for the Stone room. (When you play this card, place the Room tiles on the corresponding round spaces.)
When you play this card, you get 2 wood and you can immediately build the "Clay Oven" or "Stone Oven" major improvement. Either way, it only costs you 1 clay and 1 stone.
At the end of each turn in which you renovate, you can exchange your Joinery for the Pottery or your Pottery for the Basketmaker's Workshop.
In the work phase, after each turn in which you build at least 1 room, stable, or fence, you can build the "Joinery", "pottery", or Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement.
At the start of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Grain to skip all 3 phases of that Harvest.

insight:
Wood-fired Oven Wood-fired Oven A little better than the Windmill, but is bad for
the same reasons. It's not efficient enough to be a food engine on its own, and
its not enough points to justify the resource cost. Still, this has some use as
a way to get another bake action in the mid to late game. It can also be
returned for one of the three super ovens.
text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Wood-fired Oven to turn any number of Grain into 3 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

insight: Paying 1W for 1VP is already decent, and paying 1W for 2VP is even better. You were were planning on renovating, weren't you?
text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for a Clay hut or 2 Bonus points for a Stone house.

Place 2 Wood from the general supply on this card. Whenever you take Wood from an Accumulation space, this card gets 1 additional Wood. Whenever you pay at least 1 Wood with a person's action, you may use 1 Wood from this card as payment.

Whenever you use either the "Fishing" or "1 Reed" Action space on the middle game board, you get 2 Food if another person uses the other Action space later during this Work phase. (If the other Action space is already used, you gain nothing.)
You can consider the "Lessons" action spaces not occupied. You can replace each food that an occupation costs with wood.
Each time after you use the "Forest" accumulation space, you can return 2 wood to that space to play 1occupation without paying an occupation costs.
One of your rooms can hold 1 additional Family member.
Immediately convert 1 Grain, 1 Vegetable and 1 Cattle to 3 Bonus points and 5 Food.

improvement_complement: Animal acquisition improvements or bonuses for utilizing "Day Laborer" for additional animals.
text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 1 additional Sheep. From round 6, you can choose to receive 1 Wild boar instead.
Each time you use the "Major Improvement" or "House Redevelopment" action space, you can also play 1 occupation at an occupation cost of 1 food.
In the returning home phase of each round, you can pay exactly 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point. If you do, each other player gets 1 food.

This card is an additional Action space for all players. A player who uses it gets 1 Food and may move the person, immediately before the Returning home phase, to an empty Action space. (That Action ends the Work phase.)
At the end of the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to get 2 bonus points. If you do, all other players get 1 food each.
In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food from the general supply and you can Harvest 1 additional resource from 1 field of your choice.
Each time you use a "Lesson" action space and a cooking improvement on the same turn, you get 1 bonus point.
Whenever you Plow, you must pay 1 Food for each new field.
Each Work phase, the third person you place can use the "Plow 1 field" Action space even if it is occupied.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide food or bonuses based on the size of your house.
text: Whenever you build 1 or more fences or Plow 1 or more fields, you receive 2/1 Food if you have exactly 2/3 rooms.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for exactly 1 unfenced stable holding exactly 1 sheep. The same applies to wild boar and cattle, if held in different unfenced stables.

insight: There's a bit of a chicken and egg problem here. Before you can get room for sheep, you have to have sheep! The optimal use for the card is to build a stable, get exactly two sheep, and use this to make room for your lamb in the next harvest. However, putting this narrow plan into action is difficult, as you won't always have time to play a minor improvement in the tiny window between getting the two sheep and going to harvest.
text: You can hold up to 2 additional Sheep in each of the pastures where you keep Sheep. You can keep up to 2 Sheep in each unfenced stable.
During scoring, you get 2/5/8 bonus points for having 3/4/5 major improvements from the bottom row of the supply board.
Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 food and 1 bonus point.
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food and 1 Reed.
In the Returning Home phase after each Work phase where you gained at least 7 building resources, you receive 2 Food.
Place 3 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Storage-related improvements or those providing end-game points for collecting a variety of resources.
text: Each Harvest, you can place 1 Building resource on this card from your supply. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/5 Bonus Points for 1/2/3/4 different resources on this card.

At the start of the Work phase of each round, check which Action space holds the maximum number of a single good. You may buy one good of that type from the general supply for 1 Food. In case of a tie, you can choose between those types of goods.

In the Replenish phase of each even-numbered round, place 1 additional Wild boar on the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space. Every round, other players can only use the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space with their first person.
Instead of a fence piece, you can place 2 wood from your supply on the fence spaces at the edge of your farmyard. These fence spaces with 2 wood are worth 1 bonus point.

insight:
The prerequisites should be trivially easy to meet by the midgame, and free 1VP minors that give some small benefit are alwa
ys worth playing. You should probably get used to me saying that, because this isn't the last time you're going to hear it.
text: Place 1 Food on each remaining odd-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each major improvement you have, up to the number of your unused farmyard spaces.
Immediately build a Fireplace for free or upgrade a Fireplace to a Cooking Hearth.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition improvements or end-game scoring bonuses based on having few cards.
text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players with the fewest cards in front of them receive 3 Bonus Points. (Count Occupations plus Improvements and exclude Begging cards.)

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition enhancements or improvements providing stone in place of wood for actions.
text: At the start of each Work phase in Rounds 3 to 7, you receive 1 Wood. If there are at least 6 Wood on the "Take 3 Wood" Action space, you receive 1 Stone instead of 1 Wood.
During the scoring, if there are at least 2 orthogonally adjacent unused spaces in your farm, you get 2 bonus points. (You still get the negative points for those unused spaces.
During scoring, you get 1/2 bonus point for each pair of grain plus vegetable you have (considering all crops in your supply and fields), rounded up.

When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables on this card as you would on a field. When you play this card, it starts with 2 Vegetables planted on it from the general supply. After those Vegetables are harvested, it can be Sowed again. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that incentivize building the Well or provide bonuses for rounds when the Well is not yet built.
text: From Round 4, as long as the Major Improvement "Well" has not been built yet, you receive 1 Food at the start of each Round (even before Phase 1).
During scoring, you get a number of bonus points equal to the total of negative points you have, to a maximum of 7 bonus points.
You can no longer play this card when any player (including you) has 5 or more cards in front of them.

improvement_complement: Food acquisition improvements or those that allow additional baking or fishing actions using food from the card.
text: When you play this card, place 2 Food from the general supply on it. After each Returning home phase, you may return 1 Food from this card to use the "Fishing" or "Bake bread" action without placing a person. You can use the Food on this card at any time without the additional action.
When you play this card, you may immediately play up to 2 Occupations. (You must still pay any additional costs of the Occupations.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that convert animals to food or provide bonuses for immediate animal conversion.
text: Whenever you receive animals outside the Breeding phase of a Harvest, you may immediately convert them into Food. Take 2/3/4 Food for each Sheep/Wild boar/Cattle converted.

improvement_complement: Room-building enhancements or those providing reed cost reductions for room construction.
text: Immediately build 1 room by paying the same resources you would have to pay for the "Build room" Action, minus 1 Reed. (A Journeyman does not count as a played Occupation.)
At any time, you can exchange 1/3/5 grain for 3/4/5 food and 0/1/2 bonus points.

insight: If you sow a single vegetable once, this card is worth 1VP - that's already a decent deal for 1W. If you plan on sowing vegetables more than once, it becomes worth 2 or more points and a great deal. Since nearly every good endgame strategy involves sowing vegetables at least once, this is usually worth playing. Don't get me started on how silly this card becomes if you have an occupation that provides early vegetables. The card is interesting to compare to the Planter's Box. On one hand the Planter's Box is clearly a stronger and cheaper card. However, Potato Dibber can be played in the early game, and being able to play Dibber to set up an early 2R grab can be crucial. The fact that the two improvements are roughly equal in my book speaks volumes for how much timing affects the value of minor improvements.
text: Whenever you Sow fields with Vegetables, place 1 additional Vegetable on each field that you Sow.
During scoring, if you had at least 7 goods in your fields before the final harvest, you get 2 bonus points.

Whenever you use a Stage 1 Action space (Round 1 to 4 spaces), you may reveal the next round card and place it in front of you. You and only you can use it this round. (At the start of next round, return the Action space to the board and all players use it normally.)
For each complete round left to play, you immediately get 1 bonus point and 2 food.

insight: This is a pet favorite. One clay for 2 food isn't even that bad a deal by itself (see: the Potter), and then later you can retake SP with a free 2VP improvement to go with it. Not only is this a must-play if you have an oven, it should actually be a small incentive to go baking.
text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Food. From now, the Pottery is a Minor Improvement for you and costs you nothing.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, especially if taking stone or reed, or those allowing for delayed actions.
text: At the start of each Work phase, you may take 1 Building resource of your choice from the general supply. If you take Stone or Reed, skip your first chance to place a worker this Round (you still get to take the Action later). If you take Wood or Clay, skip your second chance to place a worker instead.
During scoring, if you then have at least 2/4/5/6 unplanted fields, you get 1/2/3/5 bonus points.
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, place 1 Food on the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
Your home may hold 1 additional animal. You may keep more than 1 type of animal in your home.

improvement_complement: Room-building improvements or those that allow for early expansion of family members without food costs.
text: If you play this card during Stage 1, place 1 person still in your supply on Round 12. At the start of this round, you can pay 2 Food to move this person into your home whether or not you have room. It counts as an adult Family member and may take actions starting Round 12.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 bonus point for each complete round left to play. You may no longer renovate your house.

improvement_complement: Clay and stone conversion enhancements or improvements providing additional food when substituting resources.
text: Whenever you take only Clay and/or Stone from an accumulating Action space, you receive 1 additional Food.
During scoring, if you live in a stone house, you get 2 bonus points for each unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your house. (You still lose the points for these unused spaces.)
Whenever you use a person's action to take Wood from an Action space, you can leave 2 of the Wood on the Action space and receive 3 Food in exchange.
Immediately after each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 reed for 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Occupation and improvement swapping enhancements or those providing benefits for discarding begging cards.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. You may immediately discard a Begging card. At any time, you may exchange 1 Minor Improvement from your hand for 1 new Occupation taken randomly from the deck.

Each round, you may place your second person on this card instead of an Action space. If you do this, place 1 Grain from the general supply on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 7 Bonus points if there are 2 Grain on this card.

For you, all "Bake Bread" actions now read "Bake Bread or place 1 Food from your supply on Kitchen Table." At any time, you may return 1 Food from this card to your supply and take a "Bake Bread" Action.

improvement_complement: Animal breeding enhancements or improvements providing bonuses for purchasing additional animals.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wild boar. If you already have a Wild boar, you receive 1 Cattle instead. In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Food to receive 2 offspring of exactly 1 animal type that breeds instead of 1.
Each time you build 1 or more fences, you can also use this card to exchange 1 wood and 1 fence in your supply for 2 food and 1 bonus point.
During scoring, if you then have more stone rooms than people, you get 4 bonus points. You can only use one card to get bonus points for your stone house.

improvement_complement: Improvements that optimize actions based on family size or provide bonuses for placing multiple family members.
text: As long as you have exactly 4 Family members, whenever you place your third person in a Round you may place your fourth person immediately afterwards, even on the same Action space. (Guests do not count as Family members.)
The next time you take animals from an accumulation space and accommodate all of them on your farm, you get 1 bonus point for each of these animals.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action, you receive 1 additional Grain.
During scoring in a game with 1/2/3/4+ players, you get 1 bonus point for every 7th/5th/4th/3rd animal on your farm.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide clay or stone based on house size or those enhancing early game resource acquisition.
text: At the start of each Work phase, you receive 2 Clay/ Stone if you have a Clay hut/ Stone house with exactly 2 rooms. (You receive nothing if you have 3+ rooms or less than 2 rooms.)

improvement_complement: Renovation enhancements or those that provide additional food for substituting resources during construction.
text: Whenever you renovate, you may substitute 1 Reed with 1 Stone. Whenever you build a room, you may substitute 2 Reed with 2 Stone. For every Reed you substitute with Stone this way, you receive 2 Food from the general supply.
Once this game, when you have 9/8/7/6/5/5 sheep on your farm in a 1-/2-3-/4-/5-/6- player game, you immediately get 2 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance field tiles' yield or use, such as those that increase grain or vegetable production to maximize the benefits of additional fields.
text: For each new field tile you get, you also get 1 wood and 1 food.
The Lighthouse provides room for 1 Family member.

improvement_complement: Resource distribution improvements or those providing benefits for sharing extra resources with other players.
text: Place 2 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Reed, and 1 Stone on four different revealed Action spaces respectively (occupied or unoccupied). Afterward, any player (including you) who uses one of these spaces may also take the extra resource(s) by paying you 1 Food first.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you return a person from the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 2 bonus points for each newborn that you return home.
At the end of the game, if all of your rooms hold exactly 1 Family member, you receive 3 Bonus points.
For each person you have, you must pay an additional 1 clay and 1 food to play this card.
During scoring, if you gained at most 2 sheep from sources other than breeding during the game and have not turned any sheep into food, you get 3 bonus points.

insight: I'm not sure how this card was ever perceived as fair in development. Free 1VP occupations with inconsequential prerequisites are pretty much always worth playing, but in this case the extra ability is quite powerful. The only caveat is that you should be careful that you're not giving your opponents easy access to reed. For instance, if you're in a 3-p game and have a choice between 3C and 2R, you should consider taking the 2R to deny your opponents. As long as you're playing smartly, however, this card is borderline overpowered and a must play whenever you draw it.
text: You can replace 1 or 2 Reed with the same amount of Clay whenever you extend or renovate your home.

improvement_complement: Family growth-related improvements or those that provide grain for families that have not yet grown.
text: As long as you did not have family growth yet, whenever one of your opponents grows their family, you receive 1 Grain from the general supply.
When you play this card, you can exchange any number of food for 1 bonus point each, up to the number of completed harvests.
When you play this card, you may return 2 different animals to the general supply to Plow 2 fields.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide food or guest tokens when opting out of an initial action space placement.
text: Each round, instead of placing your first Family member on an Action space, you may place it on this card and receive 2 Food and 1 Guest token to place that round. (You may not do this if you will be placing more people after your first without another player placing in between.)

Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" action, you may Plow 2 fields instead of 1. Additionally, you can Sow these new fields (1 or 2), but only with Vegetables. (This does not apply to the "Plow and/or Sow" action.)

improvement_complement: Vegetable to food conversion enhancements or improvements that lend vegetables for points.
text: At any time, you can convert 1 Vegetable from your supply or borrowed from the general supply into 2 Food. For each borrowed Vegetable not returned before scoring, receive 1 Begging card. (For each borrowed Vegetable, put 1 Vegetable from the general supply on a begging card as a reminder.)
Each time you renovate, you can also pay 1 wood to get 1 bonus point and 1 grain.
Whenever you add a room to your Clay hut, you can pay 2 Clay, 1 Wood and 1 Reed instead of 5 Clay and 2 Reed.
For each new stable you build, you get 1 food—for your last one, get 3 food. Each time you build stables, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 clay instead of wood.

improvement_complement: Stable building enhancements or those allowing for free construction
text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" Action with a person, you may place 1 stable from your supply on this card. Whenever you play an improvement, you may build 1 stable from this card without having to pay any Wood for it.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Stable building and animal housing improvements or those that provide additional actions for taking animals.
text: Whenever you use a person's action to take 2 or more animals from an Accumulation space, you can also build up to 2 stables, at a cost of 1 Wood each, before taking the animals.
Whenever at the end of a Work phase, you have at least 2 Family members occupying 2 orthogonally adjacent Action spaces, you receive 1 Food.

You immediately receive 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. The player on your left chooses 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Mark it with a green Arrow marker. This space must remain unused until all other spaces are used.

improvement_complement: Baking flexibility improvements or those providing grain for immediate bread baking actions.
text: Whenever you Bake bread, you may use the Clay Oven like the Stone Oven and vice verse. When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain and you can immediately take a "Bake bread" action.
You can only play this card if there are more complete rounds left to play than you have unused farmyard spaces.
When you play this card, all other players get 1 food each.
Up until all other farmyard spaces are used, you cannot use the unused spaces that are orthogonally adjacent to your house.

insight: The best cards in the deck are ones that give VP for no cost. Ironically, this means that the Madonna Statue is pretty bad, despite being a card that gives VP for no cost! Most of the time, you simply won't have two improvements that aren't worth VP sitting around. Instead, you'll usually have to chuck a 1VP improvement along with a no VP improvement, and with no additional benefit this usually isn't a good deal.
text: The Madonna Statue has no effect. (You must remove Improvements that are on the table in front of you. You may not discard cards from your hand. It is irrelevant whether you remove Major or Minor Improvements.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant end-game points for having few other improvements or those enhancing limited improvement strategies.
text: At the end of the game, you receive 9/6/4/2 Bonus points for having 0/1/2/3 Improvements in front of you.

improvement_complement: Resource sharing improvements or those that provide food when other players use the starting player action.
text: Whenever any player uses the "Starting Player" Action space, if you still have at least 2 unused persons in your home afterwards (including Guests), you receive 2 Food from the general supply.
Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces up to the number of planted fields in your farmyard. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Sheep breeding enhancements or improvements that double the number of sheep on the farmyard.
text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. When you use this Action space, you double the number of Sheep on your farmyard. You receive at most as many new Sheep as you have Unused farmyard spaces.
You immediately receive 2 Wood.
During scoring, if you live in a wooden/clay/stone house by then, you get 3/2/0 bonus points.
This is an action space for all. A player who uses it gets 3 bonus points. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for storing goods on unused farmyard spaces or providing bonuses for matching animals with goods.
text: Place 1 Reed and 1 Stone from the general supply on different Unused farmyard spaces. These spaces still count as Unused. You may take the Reed and Stone into your supply at any time. At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points if Sheep and the Reed share the same farmyard space. The same applies for Wild boar and the Stone.
When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Improvements for early game advancement or those providing a large number of points for forgoing late game actions.
text: When you play this card, you may not place any of your persons in Round 13 and 14. At the end of the game, you receive 13 Bonus points. You do not take part in the Harvest Phases at the end of Round 13 and 14. Play this card before Round 13.
Add 4 and 7 to the current round and place 1 Wild boar on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you can pay 1 Food to take the Wild boar.

improvement_complement: Improvements that convert improvement points to food or provide alternative benefits for improvements.
text: At any time, you may convert all the printed Victory points (if any) of an Improvement in front of you to 3 Food per point. After, you may not return or remove the Improvement and you no longer receive its Victory points. If Pawnbroker gets turned face down or discarded, you still lose the points.

At the beginning of each round (before Phase 1), if you have exactly 0-1/2-3/4-5/6+ Food in your personal supply, you receive 1 Wood/Clay/Reed/Stone. (You may give Food to the general supply at any time.)
Each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you also get 1 bonus point. In games with 1-3 players, this card is considered "Traveling Players" (same effect as "Fishing").
You can plant wood on this card as though it were 2 fields, but it is considered 1 field. Sow and harvest wood on this card as you would grain.

improvement_complement: Guest token acquisition improvements or those that provide bonuses for using guest tokens.
text: Place 1 Guest token on each remaining space for Rounds 7, 10, and 13. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Guest token. You must place this Guest only with your last Action that round and only on an Accumulation space.
Each time you use the "Fishing" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain and 1 wood.
When you play this card paying grain/reed for it, you immediately get 1 vegetable/4 wood.
Alternate placing 1 clay and 1 wild boar on each remaining round space, starting with clay. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
When you play this card, immediately Fence one space in your farmyard. (You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.)
The first time you have 1 Cattle, you may immediately Plow 1 field for each Harvest remaining. (If you already have Cattle when you play this card, Plow immediately.)

Place 3 Stone on the "Plow 1 field" Action space from the general supply. Any player who uses that space may also receive 1 Stone from it. If there is no Stone on that space, you may discard this card and Plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Grain field optimization improvements or those that provide bonuses for grain sown on unused spaces.
text: You may sow Grain on Unused farmyard spaces. Planted spaces count as Grain fields and do not need to be adjacent to your existing plowed fields. You may move Grain from these fields to the general supply at any time and you must before scoring (or if this card gets removed or turned face down).
Immediately place 1 clay on each unused space in your farmyard. Each time you turn a space into a used space, you get the clay and you can immediately exchange it for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, especially wood, for maintaining a small home size.
text: As long as your home has exactly 2 rooms, you receive 1 Wood at the start of each Round (even before Phase 1).
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may take up to 2 different building resources that you do not have in your personal supply.
After the feeding phase of each harvest, you can exchange exactly 1 food for 2 different building resources of your choice or 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Food conversion improvements for reducing food consumption during the Harvest Feeding phase.
text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, 2 of your adults eat 1 Food less and all other adults eat 1 Food more.
Alternate placing 2 wood and 1 wild boar on the next 4 round spaces. You decide what to start with. At the start of these rounds, you get the goods.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant wood or clay based on totals on accumulation spaces.
text: In a game with 3/4/5 players, at the start of each Work phase, you may take 1 Wood if there is a total of 7/8/9 Wood on all Wood Accumulation spaces. Additionally, you may take 1 Clay if there is a total of 6/7/8 Clay on all Clay Accumulation spaces.
Alternate placing 1 food and 1 sheep on each remaining round space, starting with food. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.

insight: I love this card with the clay oven. 7 food for 1G is absurdly efficient, and you should have no problem feeding your family with even a modest grain engine. By the end of the game, this will probably have given you 6 or 8 food. That's pretty sick for 1S.
text: Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you receive 2 additional Food.

Every harvest you may convert 1 Reed into 4 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for having 1/3/4 Reed. You do not receive additional Bonus points from the Basket Maker's Workshop.

improvement_complement: Resource exchange enhancements or those providing immediate resource swap benefits.
text: Twice each round, you may exchange 1 Reed for 1 Stone, or 1 Stone for 1 Reed. When you play this card, you receive 1 Stone.
Each time you upgrade a Fireplace to a Cooking Hearth, you immediately get 2 wood and 1 vegetable (not retroactively).
Place 1 Food on each remaining even numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
This is an action space for all. A player who uses it can exchange 5/7/9 wood for 8 wood and 2/4/7 food. When another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.
Each time you use the "Fishing"/"Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 wood/food.

insight: Helpful Neighbors Helpful Neighbors Building Materials gives you something for nothing, while this forces you to pay a different resource. The reduced flexibility makes this a generally worse card, as it requires you to have an extra resource lying around that you have no other use for.
text: When you play this card, you receive either 1 Stone or 1 Reed.

improvement_complement: Sowing enhancements or improvements that provide additional goods when using sowing actions.
text: Whenever you play an Improvement, you may immediately afterward add 1 additional good (of the sown type) on 1 sown field of your choice.
Immediately after each time you use the "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you can place another person on an accumulation space and get 1 additional good of the accumulating type.

improvement_complement: Room expansion enhancements or those that provide alternatives to renovation.
text: When you renovate your Wooden hut, you may first return 1 built stable to extend your hut by 1 Wooden room for free before paying the costs of the Renovation. (The stable can be rebuilt later)
Whenever you build a Stone room, you can Plow up to 1 field. If you paid at least 1 Stone for that room, you may Plow up to 2 fields instead.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing food for maintaining unused spaces or bonuses for unused central spaces.
text: As long as the middle 3 spaces on your farmyard are all unused, you receive 1 Food from the general supply at the start of each odd-numbered Round. (The middle spaces are those surrounded by exactly 8 other spaces.)
When you play this card, immediately pay 1 Clay and 1 Food for each of your Family members. (Guests are not counted.)
Each time you use the "Grain/Vegetable Seed" action space, place 1 food on each of the next 3/2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you build 1 or more stables in one turn, you place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

insight: Getting three occs out before round 8 is tough, so you won't be getting the full food bonus a lot of the time. Still, even if you only get 3-4 food out of this, it's always worth playing. There's enough of a potential reward here that it can even be worth rushing out in the midgame. While most 3 occ improvements are conditional on you having good occupations, this gets the extra star simply because its effect is usually tempting enough to get it out even if one of my occupations is a subpar action. A potential 7 food for no cost is very strong.
text: Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space for rounds 8 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
Place 0, 1, 2, and 3 food in this order on the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Bulk resource acquisition improvements or those providing bonuses for taking large amounts of resources.
text: Whenever you take at least 4 of the same Building resource from an Action space, you receive 1 additional Building resource of that type and 1 Food from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Resource loaning enhancements or those that distribute resources over upcoming rounds.
text: Whenever you receive Building resources from an Action space, instead of placing them in your supply, you may add 1 resource of 1 type received and place them all on the next Round spaces with 1 per space (in any order and discard any excess). At the start of these rounds, you receive the resource.

improvement_complement: Improvements that mitigate the extra food required in the Harvest Feeding phase or enhance actions taken with the second person.
text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you must pay 1 additional Food. Whenever you use an Accumulation space with your second person in a round, you receive 1 additional good of the accumulating type.
At the end of the game, you receive 4/2 Bonus points if your home has at most 2/3 rooms.
Add 3 and 4 to the current round and place 2 food on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the amount of wood in your supply. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that offer benefits for using "Traveling Players" or allow for the conversion of sheep to vegetables.
text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" Action space with a person, you receive 1 Food. Immediately afterwards, you may buy exactly 1 Vegetable for 2 Food. (If you use the Action space yourself, there is no benefit.)

insight: I hate this card. Just compare this to the Horse, which is free and has a much easier prerequisite. Usually by the time you're willing to trade wood and clay for straight-up VPs, your opponent's will have played out two occupations anyway. This probably would have been fairly costed at 1C.
text: The Outhouse has no effect. You can only build it if at least one other player has fewer than 2 Occupations. (It is irrelevant how many Occupations you have played.)
If you have a Cooking Improvement, you may convert 1 Grain into 2 Food at any time.
Place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide grain placement bonuses or benefits for using the last occupied action space.
text: At the end of each Work phase, place 1 Grain from the general supply on the last Action space you used. In the next round, if you use that Action space, you receive the Grain first. If you do not, discard the Grain.

improvement_complement: Grain and vegetable acquisition improvements, especially for those living in a stone house.
text: Once you live in a Stone house, place 1 Grain on each remaining even Round space and 1 Vegetable on each remaining odd Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the resources. (If you already live in a Stone house, place the resources immediately.)
Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
You immediately receive 1 Stone.
Once you no longer live in a wooden house, place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 Wood on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Wood.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide actions for offspring or reduce the disadvantages of "newborn" status.
text: In each Work phase in which you used a "Family growth" action and afterward you didn't use a Round 1-14 Action space, you may take an action with the new offspring and it no longer counts as "newborn".
Place 1 food on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of sheep you have. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Food and grain stacking improvements or those that provide vegetables for repeated "Traveling Players" actions by others.
text: Place 3 Food and 1 Grain on this card. The first time another player takes the "Traveling Players" action, you receive 1 Food. You receive 1 Grain the second time and 2 Food the third time. When this card is empty and another player takes the action, you receive 1 Vegetable from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Stable building enhancements or those providing discounts or food-based payments for building stables.
text: Add 3, 5, 7 and 9 to the current round and place up to 1 of your stables on each remaining corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds you may pay 1 Wood to build that stable immediately. (If you don't, return that stable to your supply. Until then you cannot build that stable.)
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, also place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
You can Renovate your Clay hut to a Stone house at any time without using the "Renovate" action. (You must still pay for the Renovation.)
Each time you use the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces and 1 stone on the round space after that. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.
Once per round, you can pay 1 vegetable to get 1 bonus point. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for early utilization of future round action spaces or provide benefits for using revealed spaces.
text: Reveal the Round card that would enter play 3 Rounds after the current Round. If it is an Accumulation space, place goods on it as if starting a Round. Immediately move the person used to play this occupation onto the revealed space and take the action if possible. During the Returning home phase, hide the Round card again.
Once per round, you can pay 1 reed. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
At the start of each round, randomly choose 1 player among the players with the least Food markers in their personal supply, to receive 1 Food. If you have the least, then you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant end-game points for unfenced stables or provide bonuses for stable placement.
text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each unfenced stable in your farmyard.

improvement_complement: Stone-related enhancements or those providing bonuses for living in a stone house.
text: Whenever you use a Stone Accumulation space, you receive 1 additional Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 rooms in your Stone house and every 2 Improvements with a printed Stone cost.
Whenever you add a room to your Clay hut, you can pay 2 Clay, 1 Grain and 1 Food instead of 5 Clay and 2 Reed.
Place 2 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food. (*Occupations and Improvements)
Immediately harvest 1 Grain from each of your Grain fields.

improvement_complement: Improvements that enable resource leveling with other players or provide additional occupations.
text: Immediately take Food from the general supply until you have as much Food as another player of your choice has in their supply. Afterward, pass this card to that player who adds it to his/her hand. Place a face-down card from the deck in front of you to indicate a played Occupation.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to three times the number of planted fields you have. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Resource exchange improvements or those that provide bonuses when other players renovate.
text: Whenever another player renovates, you may exchange exactly 2 Wood for 1 Grain, 1 Food and 1 Bonus point. (Write down the Bonus point. If you renovate, you get no benefit from this card.)

improvement_complement: Storage-related improvements or those allowing for accumulation of resources over time.
text: When you play this card, you may place 1 to 4 building resources of different types on it from your supply. At the start of each Harvest, choose up to 2 resource types currently on this card and add 1 of each from the general supply. Each round, you may take all the resources of any 1 type remaining.
Place a marker on the next round. During that round, you place 1 fewer Family member. At the end of that round, remove the marker and play 2 Occupations for free.
Immediately place 1 food on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you have built. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing food when others take specific amounts of wood or enhancing the benefits of small wood actions.
text: Whenever another player receives exactly 3 Wood from a Wood Accumulation space with a person, you receive 1 Food from the general supply.
Before the start of each round, if you have more occupations than improvements in your hand, you get 1 food.
After each turn in which you make at least one unused farmyard space used, you get 1 food.
Place 2 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, move 1 of these food to your supply. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, add 2 food to this card.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing food or grain when utilizing specific round cards or those granting end-game points for harvesting goods.
text: At the end of each Work phase, if you used both the first and latest revealed Round cards, you receive 2 Food and 1 Grain from the general supply.
Each time after you obtain at least 1 wood, if you then have 5 or more wood in your supply, you can exchange 1 wood for 3 food. With 7 or more wood, you must do so.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for double actions or provide benefits for using accumulation spaces.
text: Once during Rounds 7 and 14, you may pay 1 Food to take one of your peoples' actions twice. If you use an Accumulation space with that action, you get double the amount of Goods and/or Food.
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may also convert up to 1 Wood to 3 Food.

Immediately place 4 Food from the general supply on 1 of your empty fields. In the Field phase of each Harvest, move 1 of these Food to your personal supply. You cannot Sow this field until it is empty again.

improvement_complement: Resource and food stacking improvements or those allowing for the purchase of goods with accumulated food.
text: When you play this card, you receive 2/1/0 Wood in a 3/4/5 player game. Whenever any player plays an Occupation, add 1 Food to this card from the general supply. At any time, you may use this Food to buy Goods as follows: Sheep or Stone for 2 Food. Wild boar or Grain for 3 Food. Cattle or Vegetables for 4 Food.
In the feeding phase of each harvest, for each empty unfenced stable you have, you can exchange 1 grain for 5 food.

improvement_complement: Family growth-related improvements or those that convert wood to food when other players grow their family.
text: In Rounds 12, 13 and 14, you may not use the Round spaces 12, 13 and 14 with your first 2 persons. You may place a Guest token in each of those rounds.
Pay 1 Wood less for all Major and Minor Improvements.
Each time 1 reed is placed on a non-empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space during the preparation phase, you get 1 food.
Each time after you place an improvement or occupation in front of you, if you then have the same number of improvements and occupations in play, you get 2 food.

improvement_complement: Plowing enhancements or those that provide benefits for utilizing eastern farmyard spaces.
text: At the start of each of the next 3 rounds, you may pay 2 Food to Plow 1 of the three Eastern-most spaces on your farmyard (the farm side opposite your home) if they are unused. (Normal plowing rules still apply.) If you choose not to, discard the Sunrise Admirer.
Whenever you use the "Bake Bread" Action, you may convert 1/2 Clay into 1/2 Stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 6 food. You may no longer use the action spaces of rounds 12 to 14.

improvement_complement: Animal conversion improvements or those providing bonus points for trading animals.
text: At the start of each Harvest, you can exchange 1 Wild boar or Cattle for 1 Bonus point. If you do this, all players receive 1 Food from the general supply.
Each time any player (including you) uses the "Cattle Market" accumulation space, you get 3 food, and each other player gets 1 food.

The Night Watch is an additional Action space for all. In the Replenish phase of each round, add 1 Grain to this card. A player who uses this action must pay 2 Food to the general supply and receives the Grain. Some or all of this Grain may be immediately exchanged for Bonus points, 1 for 1.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant resources for having a specific type of house or provide benefits for having a small clay house.
text: When you play this card, if you have a Clay hut with exactly 2 rooms, you receive 4 Clay, 3 Reed and 2 Stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food for each completed round left to play. At any time, you can exchange 1 sheep plus 1 wild boar for 1 cattle.

improvement_complement: Sheep-related improvements or those that provide bonus points for storing food in your home.
text: Whenever you have at least 3 Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, place 1 Food from the general supply in your home. You may only place 1 Food per room. You cannot use these Food, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may Plow all 3 middle spaces on your farmyard instead of Plowing 1 field. (The middle 3 spaces are those surrounded by exactly 8 other spaces.)

This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it immediately gets 1 food. Immediately before the returning home phase, they can use an unoccupied action space with the person from this card.
Immediately place 1 of your people.
Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get a number of food equal to the number of wild boar in your farmyard.
Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that leverage the extra wood or reed, such as those that improve house construction or fence building.
text: Each time before you use an action space with a "Build Fences" or "Build Rooms" action, you can choose to either get 2 wood or exchange up to 2 wood for 1 reed each.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide bonuses for using the most recent round card or enhance the "Fishing" action.
text: Whenever you use the most recent Round card, you can take all the Food from the "Fishing" Action space without using a person. Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, they receive 1 additional Food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide food or grain for having unoccupied rooms or end-game points for empty rooms.
text: At the start of each Harvest you receive 1 Food and 1 Grain if you have at least 1 room in your home that is not occupied by a Family member. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus Point for every empty room.
Place 1 building resource of each type on this card. These building resources can only be used to pay for Minor Improvements.

improvement_complement: Resource stacking improvements or those providing goods for using the "Starting Player" action.
text: Place 1 Grain, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Sheep on this card. Whenever any player uses the "Starting Player" Action, you may take 1 good from this card before the Action is taken.

Place 1 Grain, 1 Vegetable, 1 Sheep, 1 Wild Boar, 1 Cattle, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed, and 1 Stone on this card. At the start of each round, before Phase 1, you randomly take 1 good. (Goods on this card at the end of the game do nothing.)
You can only play this card if you have at least as many pasture spaces as the number of completed rounds. If you do, you get a number of food equal to the current round.
For each new wild boar you get from the effect of an action space, you also get 1 food.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you have more clay than wood in your supply, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that accumulate food for unplayed "Day Laborer" actions or provide end-game points for stored food.
text: Whenever another player uses the "Day Laborer" action, you both receive 1 additional Food. In each round that "Day Laborer" is not used, add 1 Food from the general supply to this card. Whenever you play an Occupation, you may pay any costs using Food from this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/4 Bonus points for 4/6/8/10+ Food on this card.

improvement_complement: Sowing efficiency improvements or those that treat this occupation card as a field for sowing purposes.
text: Whenever you Harvest no more than 1 Grain during the Field phase of a Harvest, you may immediately sow that Grain. You may use this Occupation card as if it were a field. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)
Each time you use a wood accumulation space while there is at least 1 wild boar on the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you also get 2 food.

improvement_complement: Clay hut-related improvements or those providing end-game bonus points for living in a clay hut.
text: If there are 1/3/6/9 rounds to play you receive 1/2/3/4 Clay. At the end of the game all players with a Clay hut receive 2 Bonus points. (This card does not give Bonus points for a Stone house.)

If you have the Joinery or Sawmill, you do not have to pay the Wood cost for this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 Improvements in front of you that have a printed Wood cost.

improvement_complement: Improvements that enhance the "Traveling Players" action or convert sheep to vegetables.
text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action, you may also convert 1 Sheep into 1 Vegetable or 1 Cattle into 2 Vegetables.
In the returning home phase of each round, if you gained at least 7 building resources in the preceding work phase, you get 2 food.
Place 2 Guest tokens on this card. In the Returning home phase each Round, you can use one of these Guests to use the "Fishing" Action space. (Return the Guest to the general supply after using it.)
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can use this card to exchange your choice of 1 wood for 2 food, or 1 stone for 4 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that stack stone for building wells or provide alternatives for well construction.
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or the adjacent "1 Reed" Action with a person, place 1 Stone from the general supply on this card. You may only use the Stone on this card to build a Well. (Wells are improvements that have their name end with the word "well".)
Once per round, you can skip placing your second person and get 1 food instead. (You can place the person later that round.)
Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food and 1 Wood.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant end-game points for discarding cards under this occupation or those reducing the number of used occupations.
text: At the start of each round, you may place 1 card face down from your hand under Village Fool. That card can no longer be used for the rest of the game. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each card under Village Fool except the 3rd, 5th, 7th and 9th.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for resource trades following the "Traveling Players" action or provide bonuses for leaving food on the space.
text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action, you may leave 1 Food on the space and take 1 Wood. You may leave a second Food for 1 Clay, a third for 1 Reed, and a fourth for 1 Stone.
When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you must pay 1 food, or else take a begging marker.

improvement_complement: Improvements that utilize resources for building costs or provide alternatives for meeting building requirements.
text: Place 2 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Stone and 1 Reed on this card. You may only use these resources to pay any Building costs or functions of a card. At the end of the next Harvest, you receive 1 Begging card for each resource still on this card.
Alternate placing 1 Food and 1 Sheep on each remaining Round space. Start with 1 Food. At the start of these rounds you receive the item.
At the start of each work phase, if there are at least 3 food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 food from the general supply.
Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may immediately afterward take 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable from the general supply and Sow it.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 food for each stable you have.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition enhancements or those providing additional food or building resources for taking single resource actions.
text: Whenever you use a person's action to take exactly 1 resource from a Building resource Accumulation space, you receive an additional 1 Building resource of your choice or 1 Food. In a 4 or 5 player game, you instead receive an additional 1 Building resource of your choice and 1 Food.

Once each round that ends with a Harvest, immediately after placing 1 of your people, you may place 1 Food from the general supply on any Action space. The next player to use this Action space receives the Food (even in a following round).
Each time after you build an improvement, including this one, you get 1 food.
Place 3 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get 1 food from this card. Each time you renovate restock this card to 3 food.
Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get 1 additional food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant food when occupying unique columns of the board or provide bonuses for isolated actions.
text: At the end of a Work phase, whenever one or more of your people are the only people on a column of the board, you receive 1 Food. You can only receive 1 Food from the Recluse each round. (For example, rounds 12 and 13 form a column.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide grain and vegetables for using "Traveling Players" or enhance benefits from action doubling.
text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" Action with a person, you may immediately afterwards place a second person on the Action space to receive 2 Grain and 1 Vegetable. (The second person is not using the "Traveling Players" Action.)
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood/clay/stone into 2/2/3 food.
If you have an Oven, you can convert Vegetables into Food at any time. Take 4 Food for each Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Improvements that exchange food for wood following any action or provide bonuses for resource trades.
text: Whenever you use any Action space, immediately afterward you may place 1 Food from your supply on the space to receive 1 Wood. (The next player to use this Action space receives the Food.)
At the end of the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you may discard 1 Begging card that you received in any Harvest because you paid 1 Food less to feed your family.
Each time you use one of the four action spaces above the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 additional food.
Each time you turn a sheep or wild boar into food using a baking improvement, you get 1 additional food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant food for using even-numbered round actions or provide resources for occupying specific game board columns.
text: In each even-numbered round, you receive 1 Food after you use your first Action space. Afterward, place 1 Food from the general supply on each unoccupied Action space in the same game board column as that space. The next player to use these spaces receives the Food (even in a following round).

Add 3 to the current round and place 12 of your fences on the corresponding Round space. At the start of that round only, take your fences back and immediately take a "Fences" action without placing a Family member. (Pay fence costs normally)

improvement_complement: Major improvement construction efficiency improvements or those that provide alternatives for the costs of certain improvements.
text: Reed and Food count as 1 build point each, Wood as 2, Clay as 3 and Stone as 4. Whenever you use a "Major Improvement" Action, you may build a Major Improvement from the bottom row (Clay oven to Basketmaker's Workshop) by spending goods worth at least 9 build points instead of the regular cost.
Immediately add 1 Grain from the supply to each of your planted Grain fields and 1 Vegetable to each of your planted Vegetable fields.

You may place newborn animals of any type on this card immediately after their birth. They cannot be used for any purpose or moved off this card, but are counted at the end of the game. (This card does not count as a pasture or stable.)

improvement_complement: Family growth-related improvements or those that provide immediate action following other players' family growth.
text: Whenever another player uses a "Family growth" action, you may immediately afterward place a person out of turn.
When you play this card, you can immediately buy exactly 1 vegetable for 3 food. At any time, you can discard 1 vegetable on top of another vegetable in a field to get 4 food.

Immediately after each Work phase, you may pay 1 Food to place 1 of your people on the Joy House instead of your home. Whenever you use a person from the Joy House, you may pay 1 Food to use 2 vertically adjacent Action spaces. Use the top one first then the bottom one. (People in the Joy House also use a room in your home)
When you play this card, if you have at least 1/3/4 sheep, you immediately get 2/3/4 food. The same applies if you have at least 1/2/3 cattle.
At the start of each round, if you live in a wooden house, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing building materials when using this occupation as an action space or enhance benefits for early placement.
text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. You may only use it with the first person you place in each Work phase to receive 1 Stone, 1 Reed, 1 Clay and 1 Wood from the general supply.
Place 1 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
You immediately receive 5 Food.
Place 1 Wood from the general supply on an empty field. This field still counts as a field, but can no longer be used for Sowing or other uses. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food.
In the returning home phase of rounds 8, 10, and 12, you can take 1 vegetable from exactly 1 vegetable field. You can immediately exchange it for 3 food and 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide food based on opponents' unused spaces or enhance food acquisition based on farmyard layout.
text: At the start of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th Harvest Phase, for every opponent that has 0-10/0-8/0-6/0-3/0 unused spaces on their farmyard, you receive 1 Food each.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. For each vegetable you take from a field in the field phase of a harvest, you also get 1 food.

Immediately remove the person who played this Minor Improvement from the game completely. This person does not occupy space in your home anymore. (You can only play this card using a Family member's action. The Cypress stands for death and mourning. *without guest)

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant food when other players play high point improvements or provide bonuses for involvement in other players' actions.
text: Whenever another player plays an Improvement with 2 or more printed Victory points (excluding Bonus points), they must pay you 1 Food before.
At the end of each action in which you sow vegetables in a field, you get 1 food for each vegetable field you have (including the new ones).
When you play this card, you may either pay 1 Wood for 1 Bonus point or receive 1 Wood and pass this card to the player on your left who adds it to his/her hand.
Each time you use a wood accumulation space, if immediately afterward you have at most 5 wood in your supply, you get 1 food.
Immediately play an Occupation if you have fewer Occupations than each other player.

Place 2 Vegetables from the general supply on this card. Whenever you Plow 1 field, you may take 1 Vegetable from this card. Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you may place 1 Vegetable from the general supply on this card.
At any time: Vegetable → 3 Food; Sheep → 2 Food; Wild boar → 3 Food; Cattle → 3 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
If you play this card on the "Major Improvement" action space, you immediately get 4 food. Otherwise, you get only 2 food.

improvement_complement: End-game scoring enhancements or improvements that provide bonuses for arranging fields and pastures in rectangular forms.
text: At the end of the game, if all your fields as well as all your pastures are arranged in a rectangle form (e.g. 3x2 or 1x3), your receive 3 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for efficient fence building or provide bonuses for immediate fence construction following other players' actions.
text: Whenever another player builds 1 or more fences, you may immediately build 3/4 fences by paying 2/3 Wood. (You must obey fence rules.)
Each time after you harvest 1+ vegetables, if you then have 3+ vegetables in your supply, you can turn exactly 1 vegetable into 6 food. With 4+ vegetables, you must do so.
In each feeding phase, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 vegetable into 5 food. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point each for your 5th and 6th vegetable.

Place this card on or beside your farm. If you place it beside your farm, you gain 2 extra farmyard spaces (to be scored as normal) and you receive 1 Bonus point. If you place it on your farm, cover two orthogonally adjacent unused spaces which no longer count as part of your farm.
Whenever your extend your home, you may place 1 Wood from your supply on each of the new rooms. You cannot use this Wood any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.
Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
At any time: Clay → 2 Food Scoring: 3/5/6/7 Clay → 1/2/3/4 bonus points

improvement_complement: Improvements that enable consecutive action-taking or provide benefits for having a specific family size.
text: As long as you have exactly 4 family members, whenever you place your second person in a Work phase, you may place it between 2 adjacent and unoccupied Round cards from Rounds 1 to 7. If you do, take both actions consecutively in any order. Both Action spaces count as occupied afterwards.
At any time: Vegetable → 4 Food; Sheep → 3 Food; Cattle → 5 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
Whenever you start a round in a Wooden Hut, you receive 1 Food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. Each time before you get a "Bake Bread" action, you can build the "Clay Oven" or "stone Oven" major improvement.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing resources for fence sharing or benefits when accumulating goods from accumulation spaces.
text: If no other player has 1 of your fences, you can give each player 1 fence from your supply. Whenever one of these players takes goods (no food) from an Accumulation space, you can take back your fence from that player and get 1 Food from the general supply and that player gets 1 good of that type from the general supply.
Whenever every other player has more Family members than you, you may immediately build 1 or more rooms by paying their cost.

improvement_complement: Field-related enhancements or those that provide bonuses for utilizing the "Plow 1 field" action space.
text: At the start of each round, you may place 1 Food from your supply on the "Plow 1 field" Action space. Any player that uses that space also receives the Food. At the end of the round, if the space has not been used, you take the Food back and may Plow 1 field.
When you play this card, immediately take the Field and Breeding phases of a Harvest on your farmyard.

Immediately place a person that is not already placed on an Action space on the "After Family Growth also 1 Minor Improvement" Action space even if it is occupied by you or another player and take that action.
At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 3 grain fields (including field cards with planted grain), you get 2 food.
Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card once to turn 1 grain into 2 food and 1 bonus point.

Lege 2 NW aus deinem allgemeinen Vorrat auf diese Karte. Solange in der Erntephase mindestens 2 NW auf der Karte liegen, lege 1 NW aus dem allgemeinen Vorrat dazu. Du kannst jederzeit NW von der Karte in deinen eignen Vorrat legen. *2 Siegpunkte bei mindestens 4 NW auf der Karte

improvement_complement: Guest token-related improvements or those providing alternatives for using guest tokens in family growth actions.
text: Add 4,7, and 10 to the current Round and place 1 Guest token on each corresponding Round space. In those rounds, you may place the Guest token once as you would a person and return it after the Work phase. (The Guests do not need room in your home.)
At the start of the field phase of each harvest, if you have at least 1 grain field, 1 vegetable field, and 1 empty field, you get 3 food.
After the field phase of each harvest, you can use a baking improvement but only to turn exactly 1 grain into food. (This is not considered a "Bake Bread" action.)
Once per round, you may return 1 of you animals to the supply for a Guest token, which you place this round as you would a Family member. (The Guest represents the animal.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide benefits for building both stables and fences or provide animals for utilizing related action spaces.
text: At the end of each Work phase in which you used both the "Build Stables" action on an Action space and the "Build Fences" action on an Action space, you receive 1 animal of each kind.

Once this game, at any time, you may place 1 Stone from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space next to your home. (It now counts as used.) If you do this, place 1 Food on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (Backyard Well counts as a Well.)
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1/2/3 grain for 0/1/2 bonus points and exactly 3 food.
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can turn 2/3/4 grain into 3/6/9 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements granting food when other players use "Traveling Players" or provide additional food from the general supply for such actions.
text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" action, they must pay you 1 Food and you receive 1 additional Food from the general supply. (You receive no benefit if you use the "Traveling Players" action.)
Each harvest, you can use each of your cooking improvements once to get double the amount of food for 1 animal or vegetable.
Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, if the "Farmland" action space is occupied you also get 3 food.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition enhancements or improvements that provide additional benefits for using "Traveling Players".
text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" Action, you receive an additional Food and a building resource of your choice.

When you Sow, you can plant Grain on this card as you would on a field. When harvesting, you must (and may) immediately Bake this field's harvested Grain. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

Each Harvest, you may place 1 Food on this card from your supply. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Food on this card. You may not hold Sheep, Wild boar, or Cattle in your home (even if another card allows this).
In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1 grain from your supply plus 1 grain from a field for 2 bonus points and 4 food.
Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action in a round immediately following a harvest, you get 3 additional food.

improvement_complement: Resource conversion improvements or those that provide additional wood and clay when using "Day Laborer".
text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Wood and 1 Clay.
In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each harvested field tile that is orthogonally adjacent to your house.
Each time you use a "Lessons" action space, before paying the occupation cost, you can exchange 1 grain for 4 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant bonus points for resource expenditure or enhance major/minor improvement construction.
text: Once per round, when you build a Major or Minor Improvement, you may pay 1 additional building resource of those already paid for 1 Bonus Point.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can take a "Bake Bread" action. "Bake Bread" action: Grain → 2 Food
In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each grain field that you harvest.
When you play this card, immediately buy up to 2 (same or different) animals from the general supply. Pay any 2 building resources for each Sheep, any 3 for each Wild boar, and any 4 for each Cattle.

Place 1 Wood from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space. As long as the Wood remains, the space counts as used. You may return it at any time to convert animals to Food for the rest of that round. Take 2/3/4 Food for each Sheep/Wild boar/Cattle converted.
Once per round, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.
Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space while the "Fishing" accumulation space is occupied, you get an additional 2 food.

improvement_complement: Stable-related improvements or those allowing sheep storage on unused spaces.
text: When you play this card, you may immediately build 1 stable without paying Wood. You can keep up to 2 Sheep on exactly 1 Unused space in your farmyard. (The space still counts as unused.)
