Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Beehive Oven to convert up to 1 Grain into 4 Food. Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread without using the Beehive Oven, you receive 1 additional Food. When you play this card, you can immediately take the "Bake bread" action.

improvement_complement: Room expansion enhancements or those that allow free room construction after reaching a pasture milestone.
text: Once during the game, when you have 4 fenced pastures, you may return 1 animal to the supply to extend your Wooden hut by 1 room at no cost.
At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/5 Bonus points for having at least 2/3/4/5 fields that are orthogonally adjacent to exactly one other field.

improvement_complement: Harvest phase enhancements or improvements that convert grain to food or points outside of harvest.
text: After each Round that does not end with a Harvest, the Brewer may convert up to 1 Grain into 3 Food or 1 Bonus point. (These rounds are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 8, 10 and 12.)
If you paid wood/clay/stone for this card, place 1 grain on each of the next 2/3/4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.
In the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 2 grain, you get 1 additional grain from the general supply.
Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain.
Whenever you grow your family, you may pay 1 Stone for 1 Bonus point. When you play Birthstone, you may immediately do this for any new Family member that you already received this round.

improvement_complement: Improvements that place grain on plowed fields or provide bonuses for resource acquisition adjacent to "Fishing" or "Take 1 Reed".
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may place 1 Grain from the supply on each of your empty plowed fields. These fields are now considered planted fields. (This does not count as a "Sow" action)

During the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can use the Brazier to convert exactly 1 animal or Vegetable to Food as follows: 1 Sheep = 2 Food, 1 Wild boar = 3 Food, 1 Cattle = 4 Food, 1 Vegetable = 3 Food.
After each harvest in which you have 2 or 3+ grain in your supply, you get 1 food and 1 additional grain, respectively.
Each time you use an animal accumulation space while already having an animal of that type, you get 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide bonus points for using "Fishing" or enhance benefits when others use this action space.
text: Whenever any player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you must receive 1 Bonus point. Afterward, if you still have at least 1 person in your home, you must skip placing a person on one of your turns in that round. (You still get to place the person on a later turn).
Each time before you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can exchange 1 clay for 1 grain.

If you harvest at least 2 resources and breed at least 1 animal during a Harvest, place 1 Food from the supply on this card. You may use this Food at any time. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Food on this card.
Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field/and or Sow" Action space, you also receive 1 Stone.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow for resource conversion or those that grant bonus points for storing clay.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable. For each Vegetable that you convert into Food, you can place 1 Clay from your personal supply on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Clay on this card, up to a maximum of 5 points.
Each time before you take a "Bake Bread" action, you also get 1 grain for each of your people occupying an accumulation space.
At the start of each round that does not end with a harvest, if you have at least 1 sheep in a pasture, you get 1 grain.
Place 1 grain on each of the next 3 of the round spaces 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.

improvement_complement: Improvements that demand payment from other players during family growth actions or provide grain, wood, clay, reed, or sheep as compensation.
text: Whenever another player uses a "Family growth" action, they must first pay you 1/2 Food if they have 2-5/6+ Food markers in their personal supply.
Each time you build a number of fences equal to or great than the current round, you immediately get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Occupation-related improvements or those providing alternatives for playing occupations without placing a person.
text: At the start of each Round, before Phase 1, you may pay 2 Food to immediately play an Occupation. (Only Occupations that do not require a person to be placed can be played this way.)

improvement_complement: Good variety acquisition improvements or those providing diverse goods for Begging card acceptance.
text: This card is an action space for you only. When you use it for the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th time, you get 1 begging marker and 6/7/8/9 different good of your choice.

improvement_complement: Resource stacking enhancements or those that provide bonuses for acquiring the top or bottom resource from a stacked card.
text: From bottom to top, stack 1 Stone, Reed, Clay, and Wood on this card. At the end of each round, move the top resource to the bottom of the stack. Whenever you receive the top/bottom resource type, take 1 additional/fewer resource of that type. (Take from or move the resource to the supply).

When you Sow, you may Sow on this card as if it were 1 field. Whenever you harvest goods from this card during the Field phase of a Harvest, you must exchange these harvested goods for 1 Bonus point each.
Place 1 Food on each remaining Major Improvement on the Major Improvements Board. When these Improvements are acquired, you receive the Food.
Each time you use the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can pay 1 reed to get 1 vegetable. If you do in a game with 4+ players, place that 1 reed on the accumulation space.

improvement_complement: Improvements that reduce building resource costs or provide alternatives for new wooden room construction.
text: If there are 1/2/4/7 animals on your farm, you may pay 1/2/3/4 fewer building resources of your choice for each new Wooden room.
Immediately return 1 or 2 stables from your farmyard to your supply. Afterward, Plow 1 field for every stable returned (in the same or different space). (Normal plowing rules still apply.)
Whenever you Plow 1 or more fields, you receive 1 Wood from the supply for each field you just plowed.
At any time, you can exchange 3 grain in a field for 1 vegetable in that field.
Add 4, 7, and 9 to the current round and place 1 vegetable on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the vegetable.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant food for playing certain numbers of animals or provide alternatives for plowing fields.
text: In each round from Round 5 on, the first player to place their second person on the same gameboard as their first person must first pay you 1 Food.
At any time, you can pay 4 clay and 2 food. If you do, place 1 vegetable on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the vegetable.
Add 4 and 7 to the current round and place 1 vegetable on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you can buy the vegetable for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Pasture-related improvements or those providing cattle acquisition bonuses for large pastures.
text: Whenever you fence a new pasture that covers at least 3 farmyard spaces, you can pay 1 Reed to receive 2 Cattle.
Clockwork Man counts as 1 Occupation and 1 Minor Improvement.

You may keep up to 2 animals of the same type on each unsowed field orthogonally adjacent to your home. Different Corrals may hold different types of animals. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each of these fields that holds at least 1 animal.

improvement_complement: Wood-related improvements or those that provide additional wood when using the leftmost actions on the first game board.
text: Whenever you use 1 of the 6 leftmost Action spaces on the first game board, you receive 1 additional Wood.
At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can move 1 vegetable from one of your fields to your supply. (This is not considered a field phase.)
Before the start of each round that ends with a harvest, you can buy one of each of the following crops: 2 Food → 1 Grain; 4 Food → 1 Vegetable
Before the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to add 1 vegetable to each of up to 2 vegetable fields.
At any time, if a field contains exactly 1 good as a result of a harvest, you can discard that good and immediately take a "Sow" action limited to that field.

improvement_complement: Family growth-related improvements or those converting wood to food based on other players' family growth.
text: Whenever another player uses a "Family Growth" action, you may convert 1 Wood to 2 Food, or 1 Wood and 1 Reed to 5 Food.
At any time, you can move 1 crop from a planted field containing at least 2 crops to an empty field.

For each Grain that you Bake, you may place 1 Food from your supply in 1 of your rooms. You may have a maximum of 1 Food in each room. You cannot use these Food any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.
You may keep up to 2 Cattle on each Unused space on your farmyard, to a maximum of 4 Cattle. (The spaces still count as unused.)
When you play this card, if the number of completed harvests is equal to the number of occupations you played, you immediately get 1 food, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Improvements enhancing adjacent action spaces to "Fishing" or provide food bonuses for occupying nearby action spaces.
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or one of its neighbors ("Day Laborer", "Take 1 Reed", or the Round 4 Action space), you receive 1 additional Food for each person occupying any of these 4 spaces excluding the person you just placed.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance grain and vegetable harvest benefits or that offer additional food production.
text: In the breeding phase of each harvest, if you get newborn animals of at least two types, you also get a "Sow" action.
Each time you use a "Quarry" accumulation space, add 1 additional good of the respective type to each of your planted fields growing a single type of crop.

improvement_complement: Improvement play enhancements or those allowing for combined minor/major improvement plays following "Day Laborer".
text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you can also play a Minor Improvement or pay 1 Food to play a Major Improvement.
At the end of any Work phase in which you have taken a "Family Growth" action, you may take 2 Food from the general supply or pay 2 Food for 1 Bonus point.

Whenever you have 2/3 different types of animals at the beginning of the Field phase, you may add 1 more resource on 1/2 of your planted fields (or planted cards). (Animal cards like House Goat do not count, but animals kept on cards do.)
When you play this card, immediately carry out the field phase of the harvest. Afterwards, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action.
You can sow crops in pastures covering 1 or 2 farmyard spaces. If you do, these pastures are also considered fields and hold 1 and 2 animals less, respectively.

improvement_complement: Resource donation improvements or those providing grain, wood, clay, reed, or sheep for aiding players without food markers.
text: Whenever, at the start of a round before phase 1, another player has no Food markers, you may give them 1 Food from your personal supply. If you do this, you receive your choice of 1 Grain, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed, or 1 Sheep from the general supply.
In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional good from a number of fields equal to the number of unfenced stables you have.
Each time after you turn at least 2 unused spaces into used spaces in one action, you get an additional "Sow" action.

improvement_complement: Single-round occupation-related improvements or those providing bonuses for action spaces used by others' last person.
text: In the round you play this card, all Action spaces count as unoccupied for you. (Even if one of your people use it.) From now, Action spaces that are used by another player's last person count as unoccupied for you.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide bonuses based on limiting family member actions or end-game scoring based on the number of rounds after playing this card.
text: Starting from next round, you cannot take actions with 1 of your Family members. At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus Points for every round after playing this card, including the current round.
Place 1 Stone each on the next 2 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Stone.
When you play this card, immediately take the "Bake bread" action.
When you play this card, if you have exactly 2/3/4/5 rooms, you immediately get 1 vegetable/food/grain/vegetable.
Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain from the general supply. From round 11 on, you can get 1 vegetable instead.
Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you can choose to buy 1 grain for 1 food, or 1 vegetable for 3 food.

improvement_complement: Family growth enhancements or those allowing "Family growth" actions based on the number of planted fields.
text: Once during the game, when you have 3 planted fields, you may play the "Family growth" action as "Family growth even without room.

From now on, one of your pastures can not contain animals. (Mark this pasture with 1 Clay from the general supply.) Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you may Plow 1 additional field.
When you play this card, immediately build a Major Improvement. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally).

improvement_complement: Land development improvements or those providing alternatives for fencing or plowing on unused spaces.
text: Randomly choose 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Rules permitting, you may either fence this space or build a stable there without paying Wood. Alternatively, you may Plow 1 field there.
At the end of each turn in which you use the "Farm Expansion" action space or build an improvement, you get 1 wood back for every 2 wood paid during those actions (rounded down).
Each time you build 1 or more stables on your turn, place 1 wood on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.
Place 1 wood on each remaining even-numbered round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

improvement_complement: Food acquisition improvements or those granting animals or field actions when using a limited number of action spaces with a small family size.
text: From Round 4 on, at the end of any Work phase in which you used 2 or fewer Action spaces and have 2 or fewer Family members, you receive 1 Food. From Round 8/12, you may choose to receive an animal/Plow 1 field instead.

Once during the game, when you build at least 1 fence, you may return 1 Wooden room that you built this game and build up to 7 additional fences from your supply at no cost. If there was a person in that room, move them into the rest of your home.
When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable.
In the returning home phase of each round, place 1 wood on this card. Each time before you build a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth, or oven, move up to 4 wood from this card to your supply.

improvement_complement: End-game scoring improvements or those providing bonuses for having connected unused spaces.
text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 and a half Bonus points for each room in your Stone house rounded down and your negative points are doubled. (This also applies to Begging cards.)
Every improvement costs you 1 wood less.
Each time before you play or build an improvement, you get 1 wood.
Place 1 wood on the next 5 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood. Remove the wood promised by this card from future round spaces the next time you renovate.

improvement_complement: Animal breeding enhancements or those providing food based on other players' sheep and cattle numbers.
text: In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, you receive half a Food from the general supply for each other player who has at least 1 Sheep, rounded up. Also, you receive 1 Food for each other player who has at least 1 Cattle. (Your animals do not count.)
At the start of each work phase, if you have at least 1 clay in your supply, you can exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 clay and 1 food.

improvement_complement: Guest token-related improvements or those providing food when becoming the starting player.
text: When you play this card, place a Guest token on any Round space at least 3 higher than the current round. At the start of that round, pay the Starting player (which may be you) 1 Food and place the Guest. After that, play starts with the starting player as usual.
Add 4 to the current round and place 1 field on the corresponding Round space. At the start of that round, you may pay 1 Food to add the field to your farm.
Whenever another player Sows, you may pay 1 Food to the supply to immediately take a "Sow" action.
Immediately after the feeding phase of each harvest, if you have no food left, you get 1 wood and 1 clay.
Place 1 clay on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the clay.
Place 1 clay on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the clay.

improvement_complement: Harvest feeding phase enhancements or those converting animals to higher food values.
text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, the Chandler can convert either 1 Sheep to 4 Food or 1 Cattle to 6 Food.
Whenever you harvest the last good from a field and place it in your supply, you receive 1 Food.
Pay 1 less Wood/Clay/Stone for each Wood/Clay/Stone room. Each round you build stables, pay 1 less Wood for up to 2 stables.
When you play this card, you immediately get 1 clay. Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you immediately get 2 clay.

improvement_complement: Cooking-related improvements or those stacking food and grain for even-numbered rounds.
text: Once you have built a Cooking Hearth, alternate placing 1 Food and 1 Grain on each remaining even numbered Round space. Start with 1 Food. At the start of these rounds, you receive the item. (If you already have a Cooking Hearth when you play this card, place the goods immediately.)
Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you also get 3 clay.
Each time any player (including you) renovates to stone, you get 1 clay for each newly renovated room.
Each time any player (including you) renovates to stone, you get 1 clay for each newly renovated room.

improvement_complement: Immediate improvement play enhancements or those providing bonuses when utilizing the most recent round card.
text: Immediately after using the most recent Round card, you may play 1 Major or Minor Improvement. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally.)
Whenever you harvest at least 2 goods during the Field phase of a Harvest, you may immediately afterward pay 2 Food to play an Occupation.
Whenever you harvest at least 1 Grain, you may immediately afterward exchange 1 Grain from your personal supply for 1 Vegetable.
Place 1 reed on each of the remaining space for rounds 5, 8, 10, and 12. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.
Add 5, 7, 9, 11, and 13 to the current round and place 1 reed on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.
Add 5, 7, 9, 11, and 13 to the current round and place 1 reed on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, particularly reed, when using specific action spaces or their neighbors.
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or one of its neighbors, "Day Laborer", "Take 1 Reed", or the Round 4 Action space, you receive 1 additional Reed.
At the end of rounds 8, 10, and 12, you get 1 stone for each vegetable field you have and a number of wood equal to the number of vegetables in your supply.
Each time any player (including you) takes at least 3 stone from an accumulation space, you get 1 stone from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Food stacking improvements for future rounds or those providing immediate food bonuses.
text: Place 1 Food each on the spaces for rounds 7 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Grain acquisition enhancements for those living in clay huts or houses or providing grain stacking for even-numbered rounds.
text: Once you have built a Clay hut, place 1 Grain on each remaining even numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain. (If you already have a Clay hut or Stone house when you play this card, place the Grain immediately.)
After the Field phase of a Harvest, you can use the Festival Hall to convert 1 Grain to 1 Building resource of your choice and 2 Food.
Each time you take an unconditional "Sow" action planting vegetables in at least 1 field, you get 1 clay and 1 stone.
When you play this card, immediately take a "Fences" action. Pay 1 Wood to every other player who has at least 1 fence.
Each time after you build an improvement costing at least 2 clay, you get 1 stone.

improvement_complement: Fencing efficiency improvements or those providing bonuses for playing occupations.
text: Whenever you play an Occupation (including this one), place up to 2 fences from your supply on this card. From your 4th Occupation on, place up to 1 fence instead. You build these fences for free when taking a "Fences" Action.
Whenever you use an Action space orthogonally adjacent to the "Fishing" Action space, you may immediately take 1 Food from the "Fishing" Action space if there is Food on that space.
At any time, you can exchange 2/3/4 clay for 1/2/3 stone.
When you play this card, each player may immediately move any amount of their planted resources to their personal supply. (This does not count as a harvest).
Each time you plow a field (tile or card), you can also buy 1 stone for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Animal acquisition enhancements or those converting building resources to other types.
text: Whenever you take Wood/ Clay/ Reed/ Sheep/ Wild Boar/ Food from an Accumulation space, you may convert exactly 1 of them into 1 Clay/ Reed/ Stone/ Wild Boar/ Cattle/ Grain (respectively).

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, especially wood or food, when receiving limited building resources.
text: At the end of each round in which you did not receive any Building resources, you receive 1 Wood. If its an even-numbered round, you additionally receive 1 Food.

Place 1 Clay from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space. It now counts as used. Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may place some or all of the Food on this card. At the end of the game, you receive -1/1/2/3/4 Bonus points for 0/1/4/6/8 Food on this card.

improvement_complement: Action space accessibility improvements or those providing bonuses for using occupied action spaces.
text: When you play this card, pay 2 additional Food. Until the next Harvest, you may use Action spaces even if they are occupied by other players.
Before each work phase, you can take 1 building resource from at most one wood/clay/reed/stone accumulation space containing at least 6/5/4/4 building resources of the same type.
At the end of the game, you receive 1/2 Bonus points for 3/4 stables.
Each time you use a clay/reed/stone accumulation space, place 1 wood/clay/reed on this card. At the start of rounds 7, 11, and 14, move all the goods on this card to your supply.
Immediately place 2 of each building resource on this card. Each time any player (including you) takes at least 5 wood, 4 clay, 3 reed, or 3 stone, you get 1 of that building resource from this card.
Each time you renovate, you pay 1 fewer reed and, at the end of the action, you get 1 stone.
If you play this in Round 6 or before, place 1 Vegetable on the space for Round 8. At the start of this round, you receive the Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Resource loaning improvements or those providing bonuses for using grain or vegetables as food.
text: You immediately receive a loan of 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. Before scoring, return the 2 crops from your supply. For each crop that you cannot or choose not to return, you receive 1 Negative point.
Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 2 food total to buy 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone.
Each round, you may place 1 Guest token as you would a Family member. If you do this, you must place 1 fewer person next round. You can not use this ability in consecutive rounds nor in Round 14.
Improvements built on "House Redevelopment" cost you 1 building resource of your choice less. Fences built on "Farm Redevelopment" cost you a total of 3 wood less.
Improvements built on "House Redevelopment" cost you 1 building resource of your choice less. Fences built on "Farm Redevelopment" cost you a total of 3 wood less.

improvement_complement: Last harvest food multiplication improvements based on stone rooms and cattle or those converting excess food to points.
text: In the Field phase of the last Harvest, multiply the number of your Stone rooms by the number of your Cattle. You receive this many Food. If you receive more Food from the Knight alone than is needed to feed your family, take the excess in Bonus pts, 1 to 1 up to 5
After each harvest, you can buy exactly one of the following goods: 1 Food → 1 Wood; 1 Food → 1 Clay; 2 Food → 1 Reed; 2 Food → 1 Stone
Each time after you use an action space, you can take 1 building resource from a building resource accumulation space with at least 4 building resources on it.

improvement_complement: Grain acquisition improvements when using the Basketmaker's Workshop or those providing bonuses for large families.
text: Whenever you use the Basketmaker's Workshop in a Harvest, you receive 2 additional Grain. For this, you must have at least 3 Family members. (Guests are not counted.)
When you play this card, you immediately get 2 cattle.

At the start of each round, if you have at least 1 Grain field, place 1 Food from the general supply on this card. You may use this Food at any time. At the end of the game you receive 1/2 Bonus Points for 3/6 Food on this card.

improvement_complement: Resource sharing enhancements or those that grant building resources when other players build minor improvements.
text: Place 3 Wood, 2 Clay, 2 Stone, and 1 Reed on this card. Whenever another player pays building resources to build a Minor Improvement, you may take 1 building resource of the same type from this card.
When you play this card, immediately either discard 1 Begging card or take 1 animal (of your choice) from the supply.
Pile (from bottom to top) 1 wild boar, 1 food, 1 cattle, 1 food, and 1 sheep on this card. At any time, you can pay 1 clay to take the top good.
Each time you use the "Fencing" action space, you also get 1 wild boar.
Place 1 wild boar on each of the 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wild boar.
Your pastures with stables may hold 2 different animal types. (This card does not change the capacity of your pastures.)

improvement_complement: Grain stacking enhancements for specific rounds or those providing grain bonuses when using accumulation spaces.
text: Add 1, 3, and 5 to the current round and place 1 Grain on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain.

improvement_complement: Action space marking enhancements or those that reserve action spaces for exclusive use.
text: Each round, before the Work phase, you may mark 3 Action spaces. At most 2 of these spaces can be used by others. The third must remain free for you (even if you do not have any people left). You may choose not to use the third space.

Whenever you Sow, each field you Sow that is orthogonally adjacent to exactly 1 stable gets an additional 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable. Each field that is orthogonally adjacent to 2 or more stables, gets an additional 2 Grain or 2 Vegetables. (It does not matter if the stable is fenced.)
Each round that does not end with a harvest, you can pay 1 grain to breed exactly 1 type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)
In each returning home phase after which there is no harvest, you can pay exactly 1 grain—even from a field-to breed exactly one type of animal.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that support grain production or food conversion to utilize the unique housing capacity effectively.
text: When you live in a clay or stone house, you can pay 1 grain and 2 food. If you do, for the rest of the game, this card provides room for exactly one person.

improvement_complement: Enhancements to stables or improvements that benefit from having more people housed efficiently could be beneficial.
text: Once you have 4 field tiles arranged in a 2x2, you can use a "Build Stables" action to build a stable in the center of the 2x2. This stable provides room for a person but no animal.
In the Feeding phase of the next Harvest, each of your Family members (including newborns) require 1 Food less.

improvement_complement: Improvements that allow other players to convert grain to food or provide food bonuses when they do so.
text: At any time, any player can use the Gauger to convert 1 Grain into 2 Food. Whenever another player uses the Gauger to convert 1 or more Grain into Food, you receive 1 Food from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition improvements or those granting bonuses for harvesting multiple goods during the final Harvest.
text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players who harvest at least 5 goods during the final Harvest receive 3 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that take advantage of adjacency bonuses or enhance living space efficiency.
text: Exactly one clay or stone room in your house can hold an additional person if the room is adjacent to both a field and a pasture.

Whenever you Plow a field that is orthogonally adjacent to a planted field, you may take 1 Grain or Vegetable from that field and Sow it immediately on the newly plowed field. Place 1 fewer Grain or Vegetable from the supply on the newly planted field.

improvement_complement: Since this occupation encourages a high number of occupations, look for improvements that provide benefits per occupation card or enhance action spaces relevant to occupation play.
text: As soon as you have 6 occupations in front of you (including this one), this cards provides room for one person. In the draft variant, you need 7 occupations to play this.

Each harvest you may convert up to 1 Clay to 3 Food . At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Clay. (A repurchased Pottery does not give additional Bonus points, but can be used to convert an additional Clay each Harvest.)

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition enhancements or those providing bonuses for reducing unused farmyard spaces.
text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. After playing this card, the next player to have no Unused farmyard spaces (who currently has Unused spaces) receives 3 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Major improvement construction efficiency improvements or those allowing for the discarding of occupations for immediate major improvement construction.
text: When you play this card, you may immediately build up to 2 Major Improvements by paying 1 Food each and discarding your entire hand. (You do not need to pay the costs of the Major Improvements)
When you play this card, immediately take a "Sow" action.

improvement_complement: Immediate food acquisition improvements or those providing additional food for each vegetable harvested.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 3 food. For each vegetable you get from your fields during the field phase of the harvest, you get 1 additional food.

improvement_complement: Minor improvements that enhance animal husbandry, particularly those benefiting sheep, would complement this occupation well.
text: You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation card in front of you (including this one), unless it is already able to hold animals.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that support wild boar management or utilize animals for benefits.
text: This card can hold a number of wild boar equal to the number of completed feeding phases.

improvement_complement: Improvements that reduce construction costs or enhance the "Day Laborer" action space's benefits are ideal.
text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can also either build exactly 1 room or renovate your house. Either way, you have to pay the cost.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition improvements or those providing end-game bonuses for specific family growth patterns.
text: If there are still 6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, the player who grew to 5 Family members last receives 2 Bonus points.

When you play this card, choose one category from Grain, Vegetables, Sheep, Wild boar, Cattle, fields, pastures, or fenced stables. At the end of the game, all players with the most Points in that category receive 2 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Plowing-related enhancements or those providing field actions after playing subsequent occupations.
text: When you play your 5th, 6th and 7th Occupation, you can Plow 1 field immediately afterward. (You cannot Plow immediately if you play this card as your 5th, 6th, or 7th Occupation.)
When you play this card, you receive 2 Vegetables.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that further reduce resource costs or that benefit from building stables and fences at a reduced cost.
text: Wood rooms cost you 2 woods less. Your 3rd and 4th stable each cost you 1 wood less. Your 13th to 15th fence each cost you nothing.

improvement_complement: Sheep-related improvements or those providing bonuses for using the "Take 1 Sheep" action space.
text: Whenever another player uses the "Take 1 Sheep" Action space, you receive 1 Sheep from the general supply. (If you use the Action space, you do not receive a benefit.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that complement a quickly renovated house or enhance the benefits of fencing actions are recommended.
text: If your house has exactly 2 rooms, immediately renovate it without paying any building resources. If you do, you can immediately afterward take a "Build Fences" action.

At the start of each round, add 1 Grain from the supply to this card, unless it has Grain equal to the number of players. Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" action, also take all the Grain on this card. Whenever another player uses the "Take 1 Grain" action, return all Grain on this card to the supply.

improvement_complement: Animal acquisition enhancements or those providing choices among different animals at the start of each harvest.
text: Once you have a Stone house, you can pay 1 Food at the start of each round for 1 animal of your choice.
Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you may pay 1 additional Grain and 1 animal for 3 Bonus points. When you play this card, you may also take the "Bake bread" action.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that can leverage grain in new ways, such as those that improve food conversion or farming.
text: You immediately get 1 grain. Each time you build fences, stables, and rooms, or renovate your house, you can replace up to 2 building resources of any type with 1 grain each.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that can leverage grain in new ways, such as those that improve food conversion or farming.
text: You immediately get 1 grain. Each time you build fences, stables, and rooms, or renovate your house, you can replace up to 2 building resources of any type with 1 grain each.

improvement_complement: Unused space arrangement improvements or those providing significant end-game points for specific farmyard layouts.
text: At the end of the game, if you have 2x3 or 3x2 connected Unused farmyard spaces, you receive 9 Bonus points. (Your 6 Unused spaces are still scored as 6 Unused spaces.)
Whenever you renovate your home, or if you renovated this round, place 1 Food on the next 3 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Sowing-related enhancements or those allowing double sowing actions or immediate sowing upon card play.
text: When you Sow, you may Sow on this card as if it were 2 fields. When you play this card, you may take a "Sow" action. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may immediately afterward pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Seek improvements that benefit from having a variety of animals or enhance the capacity of stables.
text: When you play this card, you can immediately build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood. Exactly one of your unfenced stables can hold up to 3 animals of one type.

improvement_complement: Seek improvements that benefit from having a variety of animals or enhance the capacity of stables.
text: When you play this card, you can immediately build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood. Exactly one of your unfenced stables can hold up to 3 animals of one type.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits at specific rounds or enhance stable construction and efficiency.
text: Add 3, 6, and 9 to the current round. You can place 1 stable on each corresponding round space. A the start of these rounds (not earlier), you can build the stable at no cost.

improvement_complement: Improvements that benefit from additional plowed fields or enhance grain and vegetable production are ideal.
text: Each time you use the "Farmland" action space while the "Grain Seeds" action space is occupied, you can plow 1 additional field.
In Round 14, you place 2 fewer Family members.

improvement_complement: Resource exchange enhancements or those providing multiple building resources for trading vegetables.
text: Twice per round, you may exchange 1 Grain from your supply for 1 building resource, or 1 Vegetable from your supply for 2 different building resources.
When you play this card, immediately build (at no cost) up to 4 fences within an existing pasture.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing bonus points or food payment for using "Fishing" action by others.
text: Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you may pay them 1 Food and receive 1 Bonus point.

improvement_complement: "Day Laborer" action enhancements or those providing field plowing bonuses.
text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can also plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Vegetable and animal acquisition improvements or those providing sheep, stone, or bonus points for using "Traveling Players" based on player order.
text: Whenever the Starting player of the current round uses the "Traveling Players" action, you receive 1 Vegetable. Whenever the player in position 2/3/4 uses it, you receive 1 Sheep/ Stone/ Bonus point.
Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may Plow 2 fields instead of 1 and take a "Sow" action afterward.

improvement_complement: Building resource acquisition improvements or those granting additional building resources for receiving only one type in a round.
text: At the end of each round in which you received exactly 1 type of building resource (in any way), you also receive 1 more building resource of that type.
For each Wild boar, Cattle, or 2 Sheep you convert into Food, you may place 1 Reed from the general supply on this card. You may use this Reed to extend or renovate your home.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that maximize the benefits of plowed fields or offer additional food production capabilities.
text: Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space with the first person you place in a round, you can plow 1 additional field for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that utilize wood more efficiently or convert food into valuable resources or points.
text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can also play 3 food to plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that support family growth, such as those that provide additional food or living space.
text: Immediately before each harvest, if you have room in your house, you can take a "Family Growth" action for 3 food.

improvement_complement: Improvements that mitigate the negative points or enhance family growth benefits are recommended.
text: From round 5 on, if you have room in your house, at the end of each person action, you can take a "Family Growth" action with that person. If you do, you get 2 negative points.

improvement_complement: Family growth and action doubling improvements or those providing bonuses for early "Family growth" action usage.
text: Whenever you use your second Family member to use the "Family growth" Action space in Stage 2, you may immediately afterward move it and use another Action space. The "Family growth" Action space remains occupied by your newborn.
You can use the "Build room(s) and/or Build stable(s)" Action space, even if another player has already placed a person on it.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that complement sheep management or enhance the benefits of the "Sheep Market" action space.
text: From Round 5 on, each time you use the "sheep Market" accumulation space, you can also take a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.

improvement_complement: Minor improvement discarding enhancements or those providing food for discarded improvements.
text: At the start of each Harvest, you may discard up to 2 Minor Improvements from your hand to receive 2 Food each.

At the start of each round, you may place 1 Wood on this card if you have zero Wood in your supply. When this card has 5 Wood, move the Wood from this card to your supply. (You may not give Wood to the general supply for nothing)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that reduce the cost of room addition or provide benefits for family growth actions.
text: Each time you add rooms to your house, you can also pay 1 wood and 1 grain to immediately get a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer flexibility in action selection or enhance "sow" and "Build Fences" actions.
text: Place 1 food from your supply on each of the next 2, 3, or 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food back and your choice of a "sow" or "Build Fences" action.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage resource accumulation spaces or enhance clay and stone management.
text: Each time you use the "Forest" or "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can place 1 stone from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.
You may build Major Improvement Fireplaces and Cooking Hearths with a "Minor Improvement" action. Pay 1 Clay less for each.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements or those providing bonuses for early game stone access.
text: When you play this card, you receive 2 different building resources of your choice. From Round 13 on, you may use the Round 13 Action space even if it is occupied by another player.

improvement_complement: End-game scoring enhancements or those granting points for playing bonus point symbol cards after this occupation.
text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus Point for each card with a Bonus point symbol that you play after this one. (An example of a Bonus point symbol appears on the bottom of this card.)
When you play this card, you receive 1 Food for each planted plowed field in your farmyard.

improvement_complement: Improvements that benefit from managing sheep or that enhance the efficiency of person actions are ideal.
text: Once per work phase, after you complete a person action, you can pay 1 sheep and 2 food to return another person you placed home.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that benefit from building rooms or that offer unique advantages when returning people home early.
text: Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action with the second person you place, return the first person you placed home, unless it is on the "Meeting Place" action space.

improvement_complement: Game board action variability improvements or those providing exclusive access to actions from an alternate player count.
text: In a 4 player game, take the Action cards from the 5 player game and visa versa. At the beginning of each round, choose one randomly. This Action space is available for you only that round. (Fill any Accumulation space once.)
Whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Food before you pay the cost of the Occupation.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer alternative benefits for declining a "Sow" action or that enhance action space selection.
text: Each time you decline an unconditional "Sow" action on your turn, you can immediately place another person on an action space of your choice (even if it is occupied).

improvement_complement: Room construction cost reduction improvements or those providing wood when spending wood for other improvements, rooms, stables, or fences.
text: Whenever you use a "Build Room(s)" action on an Action space, you may pay 1 Wood/ Clay/ Stone less and 1 Reed less if you build exactly 1 Wood/ Clay/ Stone room. (It is irrelevant whether you build stables.)
Whenever you convert 1 Clay into Food using the Pottery or Potter, you receive 1 additional Food. The Pottery is now a Minor Improvement for you.

improvement_complement: Improvements that reduce the cost of stables or offer benefits for building stables without using an action space are recommended.
text: At any time, you can take the "Build Stables" action without placing a person. If you do, each stable costs you 1 wood and 1 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage additional wood or enhance the benefits of fencing actions.
text: Each time before you use the "Fencing" action space, you get 2 wood. Immediately after that "Fencing" action, you can place another person.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of the "Fishing" accumulation space or offer "Major or Minor Improvement" actions.
text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" Accumulation space while there are at most 2 food on that space, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that complement the "Basketmaker's Workshop" or enhance reed management.
text: When you play this card, immediately build the "Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement for 1 stone and 1 reed.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that reduce the stone cost of major improvements or that benefit from constructing rooms.
text: Each time you build a major improvement, reduce the stone cost by the number of rooms you have built onto you initial house.
Each Harvest, you may use the Mountain Cave to exchange up to 1 Wood for 1 Stone.

improvement_complement: Action space adjacency enhancements or those providing animals based on occupation of adjacent action spaces.
text: Place an Arrow marker in the intersection between 4 Action spaces. At the end of each Work phase, if 2/3/4 of those spaces are occupied by your Family members, you receive 1 Sheep / Wild boar / Cattle.

improvement_complement: Plowing and sowing efficiency improvements or those allowing for immediate plowing after sowing.
text: When you play this card, you may immediately pay 1 Food for 1 Grain. Once each round, whenever you Sow, you may Plow 1 field immediately afterward.
Once per round, you may exchange 2 Food for a building resource of your choice.

improvement_complement: Improvements that offer flexibility in resource payment for major improvements or that reduce the cost of building actions are ideal.
text: When you play this card, immediately build a major improvement. When paying its cost, you can replace up to 1 building resource of each type with 1 food each.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that benefit from new room construction or that can be built or played at a reduced cost.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. After each new room you build, you can build or play 1 improvement for 1 wood less.

When you play this card, place 1 Food from the general supply on it. During the Field phase of each Harvest, add 1 Food from the general supply to this card if it has Food on it. At any time, you may take all of the Food from this card.

improvement_complement: Good stacking improvements or those providing alternatives for sowing on plowed fields.
text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Vegetable, 1 Stone, 1 Grain, 1 Clay, 1 Wood on this card. Whenever you Plow exactly 1 field, you may receive the top item.

This card is an additional Action Space for all players. Any player who uses the Private School must pay you 1 Food to play an Occupation. All players must still pay any additional costs for their occupation (Chief, Lover, etc.).

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that trigger on stone accumulation or that offer additional actions upon the appearance of new accumulation spaces.
text: When you play this card and each time a stone accumulation space appears on a round space in the preparation phase, you get 1 wood and a "Minor Improvement" action.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that benefit from wood accumulation or that offer benefits for playing minor improvements.
text: Place 1 wood on each of the next 2 odd-numbered round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood and, immediately afterward, a "Minor Improvement" action.

improvement_complement: "Fishing" action space utilization improvements or those providing grain and building resources for using it with exactly 3 food.
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space with exactly 3 Food on it, you receive an additional 1 Grain and 1 building resource of your choice.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that mitigate the negative impact of begging markers or that enhance occupation play benefits.
text: When you play this card, you must immediately take 1 begging marker. At the start of each harvest, you can play 1 occupation without paying an occupation cost.

improvement_complement: Animal purchase enhancements or those providing food bonuses for maintaining certain sheep and cattle ratios.
text: When you play this card, you may immediately buy 1 Sheep and/or 1 Cattle for 1 Food each. Whenever you end a round with the number of your Sheep plus twice the number of your Cattle greater than or equal to the current round number, you receive 1 Food. (If the current round ends with a Harvest, you may count your animals after the Harvest.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that offer alternative benefits for the "Bake Bread" action or enhance occupation play are recommended.
text: Each time you get a "Bake Bread" action, instead of taking the action, you can play an occupation without paying an occupation cost.
At the start of the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you may return 1 Sheep to the general supply to receive 1 Bonus point.

improvement_complement: Unused space reduction improvements or those providing wood bonuses at the end of rounds where space is reduced.
text: At the end of each Work phase in which you reduced the number of your unused farmyard spaces, you receive 1 Wood. If you reduced it by 2 or more spaces, you also receive 1 Food.
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space you may immediately afterward build one room. (Pay costs for the room normally.)

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that benefit from the combination of grain and vegetable seeds action spaces or that enhance food production.
text: Each time any people return from both the "Grain Seeds" and "Vegetable Seeds" action spaces, you get 2 food and you can play 1 occupation, without paying an occupation cost.

improvement_complement: Bonus point acquisition improvements or those providing options to exchange wood and food for points.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. In the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 wood and 1 food for 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Bonus point acquisition improvements or those providing options to exchange wood and food for points.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. In the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 wood and 1 food for 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Accumulation space utilization improvements or those allowing for double action use in the Harvest phase.
text: At the end of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Wood and 1 Food to use out of turn an Action space of your choice without placing a person.

improvement_complement: Animal conversion enhancements or those providing bonuses for breeding specific animals.
text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Cattle, Sheep, Wild boar, Sheep on this card. You receive the top item when you receive that type of animal outside of the Breeding phase of Harvest.
At the end of the game, if you have all the animal types in your farm, you receive 1 Bonus point if you also have at least 2 Sheep and 1 Bonus point if you also have at least 2 Wild boar.
Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you may pay 1 additional Grain and 1 Vegetable for 3 Bonus points. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant end-game points for unfenced stables or provide bonuses for stable placement.
text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each unfenced stable in your farmyard.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage the end-game resource grab or enhance resource management in the final rounds.
text: Immediately before the final harvest at the end of round 14, you can take all the building resources that are left on the entire game board.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that benefit from early play or that enhance point scoring based on the number of people.
text: If you play this card in round 4 or before, after the final harvest, you get 1 bonus point for each person for which you then pay 1 clay.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance pasture management or offer bonuses based on the size of pastures.
text: During scoring, you get 2 bonus points of reach pasture you have covering at least 3 farmyard spaces.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that allow for creative scoring opportunities based on food placement in fields.
text: At the start of scoring, you can place food in empty fields. You get 1/2/3 bonus points for each field in which you place 1/4/7 food.

improvement_complement: Wood to grain/vegetable conversion improvements or those providing bonuses for using actions to take wood.
text: Whenever you use an action to take Wood from an Action space, you may leave 1/2/3 Wood on the space and take 1 Grain/ Vegetable/ Grain and Vegetable in exchange.

Immediately return 1 empty field to the general supply to fence a single farmyard space (in the same or different space). (Normal fencing rules still apply.) You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.

improvement_complement: Food stacking improvements or those providing grain and food bonuses for "Day Laborer" actions by others.
text: You receive 2 Food before you pay the costs of playing this Occupation. In the Returning home phase of each Round, you must choose 1 player among those who built or played a new card that round. That player receives 1 Food from the general supply. (You may choose yourself if possible.)
Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you receive 1 Reed.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that increase room capacity or offer benefits for having more rooms than people.
text: If you play this card in round 11 or before, during scoring, you get 4 bonus points if you then have more rooms than people.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that benefit from late-game card play or that enhance accumulation space actions.
text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each card played after this on that has "accumulation space(s)" in its text.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for returning people from accumulation spaces or that enhance point-buying opportunities.
text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you return at least 3 people from accumulation spaces, you can buy 1 bonus point for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Renovation and action substitution enhancements or those providing reed and food when substituting building resources.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Reed and 1 Food. Instead of the "Build Room(s)" action on the corresponding Action space, you may take the "Renovate" action and vice versa. (This card does not effect additional actions on those spaces.)

improvement_complement: Grain field-related improvements or those providing wood bonuses when planted grain fields are present.
text: Whenever you have at least 1 planted Grain field at the start of a Harvest, you receive 2 Wood.
Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces, up to the number of planted fields in your farmyard. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.
When you play this card, you receive 3 Food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance cooking options or offer points for cooking improvements.
text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each cooking improvement you have.

improvement_complement: Future round action preview improvements or those providing bonuses for early utilization of future actions.
text: Add 3 to the current round number and place the person who played this Occupation on the corresponding round space. (It is no longer considered part of your family until then.) At the start of that round, you receive the person back, even if you have no room in your home, and you receive 2 Food, 1 Bonus point, and 1 Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that benefit from the ownership of specific upgrades or that offer point-buying opportunities based on specific conditions.
text: Each harvest, if any player (including you) owns the Joinery or an upgrade thereof, you can buy exactly 1 bonus point for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Food acquisition enhancements for maintaining a stone stockpile or those providing additional food for having stone.
text: Whenever you have at least 3/5 Stone in your supply at the start of the Work phase, you receive 1/2 Food.
You immediately receive 1 Building resource of your choice.

When you play this card, immediately return a stable from your farmyard to your supply and extend your Wooden hut by 1 room. (The room does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown on this card.)

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that leverage grain exchanges or offer food production based on the number of unfenced stables.
text: Once per round, if you have 0/1/2/3/4 unfenced stables on your farm, you can exchange 2 grain for 1 bonus point and 1/2/3/4/5 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance the benefits of the "Grain Utilization" action space or offer point-buying opportunities based on food placement.
text: Each time after you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you can buy 1 bonus point for 1 food. Place the food on the action space (for the next visitor).

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that provide immediate resource bonuses based on the number of players or that enhance resource management.
text: When you play this card in a 1-/2-/3-/4- player game, you immediately get 2 grain/3 clay/2 reed/2 sheep.

improvement_complement: Exclusive early action utilization improvements or those providing bonuses for using multiple late-stage actions.
text: In Round 14, immediately before the Starting player places his first person, you may use 1 of your people to use all the Action spaces for Rounds 11,12,13 and 14 in any order. Leave your person on the last space you used. The Work phase is over for you. (You cannot place anymore people.)

improvement_complement: Occupation-related improvements or those providing food bonuses for converting building resources during Harvest.
text: You receive 1 Food for each Occupation and for each Improvement used by any player to convert building resources to Food during Harvest.

The Ram counts as a Sheep in your farm for scoring and breeding, but must be fed 1 Food in the Feeding phase of each Harvest or it is discarded. Your Sheep breed at the end of Rounds 6, 8, 10, and 12.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for returning stables to supply or that enhance minor improvement actions.
text: At the start of each returning home phase, you can return a built stable to your supply to get 1 wood, 1 grain, 1 food, and a "Minor Improvement" action.
Whenever you convert animals into Food, you receive 1 additional Food for each animal.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that leverage wood management or offer resource conversion benefits.
text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can place 4 wood from your supply on that space to get 2 stone, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Fishing and reed acquisition enhancements or those providing additional stone or grain/vegetable for adjacent action space utilization.
text: Each time you use "Fishing" or "Reed Bank", you can pay 1 food to immediately place another person on this card. If you do, you get your choice of 3 stone or 1 grain plus 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: "Traveling Players" action doubling improvements or those allowing free space utilization following its use.
text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you may move any person from an Action space with exactly 1 person on it to "Traveling players" also. (They don't use action.) Afterward, you may immediately use the freed Action space with another person.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer alternatives for declining improvement actions or that enhance resource management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you decline a "Minor/Major Improvement" action, you get 1 food/vegetable instead.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance the exchange options provided by this occupation or that offer benefits for animal and crop management.
text: At the start of each round, you can make exactly one of the following exchanges: 1 Cattle → 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable → 1 Cattle; 2 Sheep → 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable → 2 Sheep; 2 Food → 1 Grain; 1 Grain → 2 Food

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of food accumulation spaces or offer resource management benefits based on food taken.
text: Each time you take 1/2/3+ food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 vegetable/grain/reed.

improvement_complement: Improvement cost reduction enhancements or those providing bonuses for having fewer improvements than other players.
text: If you have fewer Improvements than 2/3/4 other players, you may pay 1/2/3 building resource less of your choice when you play an Improvement.
Place 1 Food each on up to 3 Unused farmyard spaces from the general supply. When the space is used, you receive the Food.
You may Sow fields even if they already contain resources. Place the new resources on top of the existing ones. You cannot Sow different resources on a single field.

improvement_complement: Harvest-related improvements or those providing additional grain harvesting bonuses.
text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" or "Plow and/or Sow" Action space, you may take the Field phase of a Harvest on your farmyard before taking the action. (This does not count as a Harvest.)

improvement_complement: Stable construction and field plowing efficiency improvements or those allowing for immediate field actions after building stables.
text: Whenever you build at least 1 stable, you may also pay 1 Food to immediately Plow 1 field.
You may Sow and harvest Reed in your fields as if it were Grain. At the end of the game, you may exchange 1/4/6/8 Reed from your supply or from your fields for 1/2/3/4 Bonus points.
Whenever you Sow during an even-numbered round, add 1 additional resource of the appropriate type to 1 field you just sowed.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that allow for flexible animal exchanges or enhance the management of specific animals.
text: At any time, you can exchange 1 sheep for either 1 wild boar, 1 vegetable, or 1 stone.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that benefit from wood accumulation or enhance food production based on wood management.
text: In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 wood/1 food for each wood accumulation space with exactly 2 wood/at least 3 wood.
When you Sow, you can plant 2 Grain fields on this card. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage the additional clay and food or that enhance field tile management.
text: For each new field tile you get, you also get 1 clay and 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer cost-effective resource purchases or that enhance harvest benefits.
text: Once each harvest, you can buy 1 wood, 1 reed, and 1 grain for 2 food total.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that provide resource diversity benefits or that enhance the initial resource boost.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 good of each of the following types, If you have at least 2 of that good in your supply already, food, grain, vegetable, reed, wood.

improvement_complement: Animal housing on occupations or those that provide bonuses for played occupations with animals.
text: You may keep any 1 animal on each of your played Occupation cards.
Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you may Plow 2 fields if they are not diagonally or orthogonally adjacent to each other instead of 1.

improvement_complement: Clay and stone conversion enhancements or improvements providing additional food when substituting resources.
text: Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get 1 food. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, you also get 1 grain.
Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may immediately afterward Sow 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition enhancements or those providing wood bonuses when receiving large amounts of non-wood items.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wood. Whenever you receive 3 or more items of the same type (excluding Wood) from an Accumulation space, you receive 1 Wood. (Accumulation spaces are Action spaces where Goods or Food accumulate.)

improvement_complement: Exclusive family growth action space utilization or those providing wood for family growth actions by others.
text: In the next round and in Round 13 and 14, only you can take a "Family growth" Action space with your first person. (Any player can take it with their second person or higher.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for resource accumulation phases or that enhance food production.
text: Immediately before the start of each round, if there are goods on the remaining round space that are promised to you, you get 1 food.
Place 4 Stone on this card from the general supply. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you may move 1 Stone from this card to your supply.

improvement_complement: Resource stacking improvements or those providing stone or grain/vegetable bonuses for accumulation space utilization.
text: Place 4 stacks of resources on this card: 3 Wood, 3 Clay, 2 Stone, and 1 Grain with 1 Vegetable. In the Field phase of each Harvest you can buy (some or all of) these stacks. Pay 2/3/4/5 Food for the 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd/ 4th stack you buy.
Your home now creates a natural border for pasture(s). You may not extend your home into pastures created in this way. (You may still build all 15 fences.)

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance grain and vegetable harvest benefits or that offer additional food production.
text: In the field phase of each harvest, each time you take the last grain/vegetable from a field, you also get 2 food/1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage grain conversion or that offer timing-based resource boosts.
text: At any time, you can pay 1 grain. If you do, add 2 to the current round and place 4 food on the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer flexibility in resource conversion or that enhance end-of-round benefits.
text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you have at least 1 clay, you can use this card to discard all of your clay and get your choice of 3 food or 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces or that enhance food acquisition.
text: Each time you place your 1st/2nd/3rd person in a round on a building resource accumulation space with exactly 5/4/3 building resources, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Resource and animal variety improvements or those providing bonuses for playing occupations.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wood, 1 building resource of your choice, 1 Sheep, 1 Wild Boar, 1 Food, 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. Also, you may receive 2 Bonus points. In the Returning home phase of this round, remove 1 of your Family members from the game completely.

improvement_complement: Workshop enhancement improvements or those reducing resource costs for playing improvements.
text: If you have the Joinery/ Pottery/ Basketmaker's Workshop or their upgrades, you receive an additional 2 Wood/ 2 Clay/ 1 Reed whenever you use a Family member's action to take only Wood/ Clay/ Reed.
At the beginning of each Harvest, you may exchange 1 Grain or Vegetable for 1 Sheep. Alternatively, you may exchange 1 Sheep for 1 Grain or Vegetable.
At the end of any turn where you placed a person on a "Renovation" Action space, you may return that person to your farm. (That person takes another action later in the round.)

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance the benefits of the "Bake Bread" action or that offer additional baking opportunities.
text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get an additional "Bake Bread" action.

improvement_complement: Stone to clay conversion improvements or those providing food bonuses for paying clay instead of stone.
text: Whenever you play an Improvement and you would pay Stone as a building material, you may replace that Stone with the same amount of Clay if you pay an additional 1 Food.

You may keep up to 2 Sheep on each Unused space in your farmyard. (The spaces still count as unused.) You may not keep any animal other than Sheep in your home. The Sheepdog must be fed 1 Food each Harvest. (You must beg if you don't have enough Food).

improvement_complement: Food acquisition enhancements for pasture possession or those providing bonuses for having a certain number of pastures.
text: In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1/2/3/4 Food if you have 2/3/4/5 pastures.
At any time, you can convert pairs of goods to Food as follows: 1 Grain + 1 Vegetable to 5 Food 1 Grain + 1 Sheep to 4 Food 1 Grain + 1 Wild boar to 5 Food 1 Grain + 1 Cattle to 6 Food

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that benefit from occupation play or that enhance resource management based on occupation count.
text: Immediately before playing each occupation after this one, you can pay 1 wood total to get 1 food for each occupation you have in front of you.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer alternatives for grain use or that enhance point and food production.
text: After the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 grain into your choice of 3 food or 1 bonus point.
At the end of the game, if you own a Fireplace, you receive 2 Bonus points.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance the benefits of playing improvements from hand or that offer additional food production.
text: Each time you take a "Major or Minor Improvement" action to play an improvement from your hand, you also get 3 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance the benefits of the "Sow" action or that offer additional food production.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time after you use an action space with the "Sow" action, you get 2 food.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition improvements or those providing resources for players using the "Traveling Players" action.
text: If you play this card in Stage 1, you immediately receive 6 wood. Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Player" action, you must pay him 1 Wood if you have any in your supply.
Once during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you can Plow up to 4 fields instead of 1.

improvement_complement: Sowing and baking efficiency improvements or those allowing grain purchase before action utilization.
text: Whenever you use the "Sow and/or Bake bread", "Plow 1 Field", or "Plow and/or Sow" Action spaces, you may buy 1 Grain for 1 Food before taking the action.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of the "Fishing" accumulation space or that offer additional resource management based on food accumulation.
text: Each time there is 1/2/3+ food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food on the "Reed Bank"/ "Clay Pit"/ "Grove" accumulation spaces.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer end-of-preparation phase benefits or that enhance stone and vegetable management.
text: At the end of each preparation phase, if you have at least 1 stone in your supply, you get 1 food. In round 14, you get 1 vegetable instead.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer additional benefits for constructing clay rooms or renovating to stone.
text: Each time you build at least 1 clay room or renovate your house from clay to stone, you also get 3 food.
Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may immediately afterward take the "Sow" action.

Remove 1 built stable and place it on this card (you may not build it again later). Whenever you play a Minor Improvement, take 1 Building resource of your choice from the general supply before paying the costs of the Improvement.

improvement_complement: Good stacking improvements or those providing top item bonuses for field harvesting during Harvest.
text: Pile 6 building resources of your choice, but including at least 1 of each type, on this card in any order. During the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive the top item.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition improvements when others take wood or those providing wood bonuses for specific wood actions.
text: Whenever another player takes 1 to 3 Wood from a Wood Accumulation space with a person, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply. (When you take Wood, you receive no benefit.)

improvement_complement: "Day Laborer" action enhancements or those providing field plowing bonuses.
text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may also Plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for renovating or that provide round-based food bonuses.
text: Each time you renovate, place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of building clay rooms or that offer point scoring opportunities based on construction actions.
text: For each clay room you build, you get 2 food and 1 bonus point. (this does not apply to stone rooms and renovated wood rooms.)
At the end of the game, you receive 3 Bonus points if you have at least 5 plowed fields, 8 Grain and 4 Vegetables. (Planted Grain and Vegetables count).

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that leverage food management based on the current round number or that offer additional food production.
text: Before the start of each round, if you have food equal to or higher than the current round number (e.g., 8+ food in round 8), you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Sheep acquisition improvements for grain actions or those providing grain when taking sheep.
text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" action, you receive 1 additional Sheep. Whenever you use the accumulating "Sheep" action, you receive 1 additional Grain.
Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces, up to the number of completed rounds. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for room construction or that provide round-based food bonuses.
text: Each time you build at least 1 room, you can place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Grain acquisition enhancements during harvest or those providing bonuses for immediate grain harvesting.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. In each Field phase of Harvest, you may harvest 1 additional Grain from each of your Grain fields.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance grain harvest benefits or that offer additional grain production opportunities.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional grain from each of your grain fields.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using specific action spaces or that enhance grain management.
text: Each time you use the action space card that has been revealed right before the most recent harvest, you also get 1 grain.
Whenever another player builds a room or renovates, you may immediately perform this action yourself (without placing a Family member). Pay the costs using 1 less building resource of your choice.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that enhance clay and crop management or that offer benefits for using "Grain Seeds" and "Vegetable Seeds" action spaces.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 2 clay. Each time after you use a "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you get 1 clay.

improvement_complement: Room building cost reduction improvements or those providing free additional rooms when using "Build rooms" action.
text: If you are the only player to have only 2 rooms in your home and you use a "Build rooms" action on an Action space to build at least 1 room, you may build 1 additional room for free.
