Once per turn, when paying a cost, you may discard 1 card from your hand to pay 1 less Building resource of your choice.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using the "Major Improvement" action space or that enhance crop management.
text: Each time you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you also get 1 grain and, afterward, you can take a "Sow" action.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage grain conversion into vegetables or that enhance food and vegetable management.
text: For each grain you harvest from a field, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3 food. If you harvest the last grain from a field, the vegatble costs you only 2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of grain harvest in specific conditions or that offer vegetable placement benefits.
text: Each time you use a "Lessons" action space, you get 1 vegetable in each of your fields with at least 3 grain and no vegetable. Place the vegetable below the grain.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer cost-effective grain and vegetable acquisition or that act as additional fields.
text: When you play this card, you can choose to buy 1 grain for 1 food, or 1 vegetable for 3 food. This card is a field.
At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 4 food Sheep: 2 food Boar: 3 food Cattle: 4 food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 3 food each.

improvement_complement: Early action doubling improvements or those providing food payment options for consecutive action placement.
text: Each Work phase on your first turn, you may pay 2 food to place both your first and second person immediately one after another. If you do this, you must place each person on a different game board. (Then, when it's your second turn, you place your third person.)

improvement_complement: Plowing-related improvements or those providing bonuses for not having empty plowed fields.
text: At the start of each round, if you have no empty plowed fields on your farm, you may pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.
Immediately add 1 animal of the appropriate type to each Accumulation space containing 2 or more animals. If you have space on your farm, you may take 1 of the added animals.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for end-of-harvest vegetable acquisition or that enhance food management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. At the end of each harvest, you can buy exactly 1 vegetable for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Fishing and reed acquisition enhancements or those providing additional stone or grain/vegetable for adjacent action space utilization.
text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" or "Take 1 Reed" Action space (on the second game board), you may later in the same round, pay 1 Food to place a person on this card. If you do this, you receive either 3 Stone or 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for having excess living space or that enhance crop and food management.
text: At the start of each round, if you have at least 3 rooms but only 2 people, you get 1 food and 1 crop of your choice (grain or vegetable)

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements or those providing options to purchase grain and vegetables at reduced costs.
text: Place 2 grain and 2 vegetables on this card. You can buy them at any time. Each grain costs 2 food; each vegetable costs 3 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage clay and stone conversion into crops or that enhance resource management based on accumulation space use.
text: Each time after you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can place 1 stone/2 clay from your supply on the space to get 2 grain/1 vegetable, respectively.
In each Harvest, you can use the Stonecutter's Hall to convert at most 1 Stone to 3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Stone.

improvement_complement: Fence and stable construction improvements or those providing bonuses for building before final Harvest.
text: You may immediately build up to 4 fences and 1 stable for free. At the end of the final Harvest, you must return 4 Wood to the general supply. If you cannot, you must take 1 Begging Card for each Wood you cannot return.

You immediately receive 1 Vegetable. Once each round, you may move 1 Vegetable from your supply onto a future Round space. If it is at least 5 rounds away, add 1 Vegetable from the general supply. At the start of that round, you must convert each of those Vegetables to 2 Food or 1 Bonus point.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that enhance the benefits of using wood accumulation spaces or that offer additional "Sow" actions.
text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you also get a "Sow" action for exactly 1 field.

improvement_complement: Clay to food conversion improvements or those providing immediate clay acquisition when playing this occupation.
text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Clay. At any time you may convert 1 Clay into 1 Food.
Whenever another player takes the "Fishing" action, you can take 1 Grain or Vegetable from each of your planted fields and place it in your personal supply. (This also applies to field cards.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance the benefits of animal breeding or that offer additional crop placement opportunities.
text: In the breeding phase of each harvest, for each newborn animal you get, you can sow crops in exactly 1 field.

improvement_complement: Vegetable sowing improvements or those providing immediate sowing options for vegetables acquired outside Harvest.
text: Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 reed from the general supply on that card. At any time, you can move the reed to your supply or exchange it for a "Sow" action.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance pasture capacity or that offer additional crop placement benefits.
text: You can hold 1 additional animal in each pasture without a stable. Each time you sow in a field, you can place 1 additional crop of the respective type in that field.

improvement_complement: Road construction between action spaces or those providing additional fences for personal use.
text: At the start of each round, you may pay 1 Stone to place 1 of your unused fences as a road between 2 orthogonally adjacent Action spaces. At the end of each Work phase, you may use 1 empty Action space with a road to one occupied by you.

Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, add 2 Food from the general supply to this card. You receive the Food on this card when you use the "Fishing" action. Each Harvest, return 1 Food from this card (if any) to the general supply.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for playing occupations or that enhance wood management based on occupation costs.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time you play an occupation after this one, you get 1 wood for each food paid as occupation cost.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for playing occupations or that enhance wood management based on occupation costs.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time you play an occupation after this one, you get 1 wood for each food paid as occupation cost.

improvement_complement: Vegetable conversion efficiency improvements or those reducing food needs when using vegetables for food.
text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, your people need only 1 Food each if the Food comes from Vegetables converted in that Feeding phase. (People who are not fed with Vegetables feed normally.)

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that leverage reed management or that offer additional wood benefits.
text: When you play this card and each time 1 reed is placed on an empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space in the preparation phase, you get 1 wood.
Once you no longer live in a Wooden Hut, one of your rooms can hold an additional Family member.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer unique wood accumulation benefits or that trigger on specific action space appearances.
text: This card is a "1 Wood" accumulation space for you only. Each time the newly revealed action space card is a "Quarry" accumulation space, you must discard all wood from this card.

improvement_complement: Occupation and animal bonuses or those providing sheep for playing occupations.
text: In the future, whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Sheep afterward.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance wood accumulation or that offer additional wood benefits.
text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get 1 additional wood.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits based on stone and clay balance or that enhance wood acquisition.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. After each work phase, if you have more stone than clay in your supply, you get 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using action spaces adjacent to occupied spaces or that enhance wood acquisition.
text: Each time you use an action space that is orthogonally adjacent to another action space occupied by one of your people, you get 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Grain acquisition enhancements or those providing alternative purchasing options for vegetables.
text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. At the end of each Harvest, you may buy up to 1 Vegetable for 2 Food.
Whenever you use the "Take 1 Vegetable" action, you receive 1 additional Vegetable.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements or those providing bonuses for being the first occupation played.
text: If this is your first Occupation, immediately take 1 building resource of your choice for each completed round of the game.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits based on the number of improvements in play or that enhance wood management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood fore each improvement in front of you.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that reduce the wood cost of other improvements or that offer benefits for paying food instead of wood.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. Each improvement costs you up to 2 wood less, if you pay 1 food instead.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that reduce the wood cost of other improvements or that offer benefits for paying food instead of wood.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. Each improvement costs you up to 2 wood less, if you pay 1 food instead.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage a wood stockpile or that offer benefits for card play.
text: When you play this card, immediately place 6 wood on it. Immediately after each time you play a card from your hand, including this one, you get 1 wood from this card.

improvement_complement: Immediate food acquisition improvements or those providing additional food for each vegetable harvested.
text: When you play this card, you receive 3 Food. For each Vegetable that you receive from your fields in the Field phase of Harvest, you receive 1 additional Food.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, especially wood, for maintaining a small home size.
text: As long as you live in a house with exactly 2 rooms, at the start of each round, you get 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for wood acquisition or that allow for cost-effective wood purchases.
text: In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 wood and you can buy up to 2 additional wood for 1 food each.

You may Sow 1 of your rooms as if it were 1 field. Whenever you have an animal in your home (including House Goat), move all resources planted in this room to the general supply. Harvest resources from your room as normal and additionally at the end of Rounds 6, 8, 10 and 12.

improvement_complement: Wood stocking enhancements or those providing bonuses for high wood expenditure in a round.
text: Each round, if you spend 4 or more Wood for Improvements, rooms, stables, or fences, you receive 2 Wood at the end of the round.

improvement_complement: Good variety acquisition improvements or those providing diverse goods for Begging card acceptance.
text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. When you use this Action space the 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd/ 4th time, you receive 1 Begging card and 6/7/8/9 different Goods of your choice. (Goods are Grain, Vegetables, building resources and animals.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific action spaces or that enhance wood and food management.
text: Each time you use the "Farmland", "Grain Seeds", Grain Utilization", or "Cultivation" action space, at the end of that turn, you get 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that enhance wood accumulation based on fencing actions or that offer round-based wood benefits.
text: You immediately get 1 wood. Additionally, place 1 wood on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you built. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for renovating or that enhance wood and clay management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 clay. Each time after you renovate, you get a number of wood equal to the number of people you placed that round.
Whenever you use the "1 Reed" Action space, you receive 1 additional Food. Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 1 additional Reed.

improvement_complement: Resource stockpiling enhancements or those granting building resources for maintaining a variety of animals.
text: When you play the card, if there are no animals on your farm, place 5 Wood, 4 Clay, and 3 Stone on this card. At any time, if you have 5/7/9 animals, you receive all the Wood/ Clay/ Stone on this card.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that enhance grain acquisition or that offer additional clay benefits.
text: Place 8 clay on this card. For each grain you obtain, you also get 1 clay from this card.

improvement_complement: Resource conservation improvements or those providing end-game bonus points based on family size.
text: You may only play this Occupation when you have 3 or less resources and it is Round 11 or before. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Family member. (Resources are Grain, Vegetables, and building resources. You may return building resources to the general supply for nothing at any time.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific action spaces or that enhance clay acquisition.
text: Each time before you use the action space card left of the card that has been most recently placed on a round space, you get 2 clay.

improvement_complement: Occupation rotation improvements or those providing food payment options for playing occupations in future rounds.
text: Place 1 Occupation (from your hand) face down on each space for rounds 5,7,9, and 11. At the start of these rounds, you can pay 2 Food to play the Occupation. If you do not, return it to your hand.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using "Lessons" action spaces or the "Clay Pit" accumulation space.
text: When you play this card and each time after you use a "Lessons" action space or the "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you get 1 clay.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage clay and stone management or that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces.
text: Each time you use the "Forest" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 clay. In games with 3 or more players, this also applies to the "Clay Pit".

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer cost-effective clay acquisition or that enhance resource management.
text: Wne you play this card, you immediately get 2 clay. At any time, but only once per round, you can buy 2 clay for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance the management of clay and stone or that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces.
text: Each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you also get 1 of the other good, stone/clay.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage clay and wood management or that enhance the benefits of the "Grain Utilization" action space.
text: Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you also get 2 clay and 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide clay or stone based on house size or those enhancing early game resource acquisition.
text: As long as you live in a clay/stone house with exactly 2 rooms, at the start of each work phase, you get 2 clay/stone.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for constructing new rooms or renovating and that enhance clay and stone management.
text: For each new wood/clay room you build, you get 2 clay/2 stone.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for having multiple rooms or that enhance stone acquisition based on room count.
text: When you play this card, you can immediately pay 1 food to get 1 stone for each room you have.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer flexibility in resource conversion into stone or that enhance resource diversity management.
text: At any time, you can place a good from your supply on this card to get 1 stone. You must place different goods on this card. (Food is also considered a good.)

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for early-round actions or that enhance stone acquisition during specific rounds.
text: Each time before you use an action space card on round spaces 5 to 7, you get 1 stone.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer cost-effective stone acquisition based on the harvest phase or that enhance resource management based on food payment.
text: In the breeding phase of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, you can use this card to buy exactly 2 stone for 2/2/3/3/4/1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for enclosing farmyard spaces or that enhance stone acquisition.
text: In each work phase, after you enclose at least one farmyard space, you get 2 stone. (Subdividing an existing pasture does not count.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer round-based building resource acquisition or that enhance resource management based on the game's timing.
text: Place 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone in this order on the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective building resource.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage wood and clay accumulation spaces or that offer cost-effective resource acquisition.
text: Each time you use a wood or clay accumulation space, you can also buy exactly 1 building resource. Wood, clay, and reed cost 1 food each; stone costs 2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for early placement on accumulation spaces or that enhance resource management based on preemptive action selection.
text: Before the start of each work phase, you can place a person on an accumulation space of a building resource not in your supply. (Then proceed with the start player.)

improvement_complement: Improvements that grant resources for having a specific type of house or provide benefits for having a small clay house.
text: When you play this card, if you live in a clay house with exactly 2 rooms, you immediately get 3 clay, 2 reed, and 2 stone.

improvement_complement: Resource conversion improvements or those that provide additional wood and clay when using "Day Laborer".
text: Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you get 1 additional wood and clay, and you can buy 1 stone for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for harvesting field tiles or that enhance resource management based on crop production.
text: Pile 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 reed, 1 clay, and 1 wood on this card. Each time you harvest a field tile, you can also take the top good from the pile.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for early-round actions or that enhance building resource acquisition during specific rounds.
text: Each time before you use an action space card on round spaces 1/2/3/4, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer alternative action spaces or that enhance flexibility in action selection based on room count.
text: This card is an action space for you only. If each other player has more rooms than you, it provides the "Day Laborer", "Building Rooms", and "Major Improvement" actions (all three).

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer temporary housing benefits or that enhance action selection until round 9.
text: This card provides room for one person, but only until the returning home phase of round 9. If, by then, there is no room elsewhere for that person, remove it from play.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for late-game family growth or that enhance resource management based on specific costs.
text: When you play this card in round 5 or later, you can immediately pay 1 stone, 1 grain, 1 vegetable, and 1 sheep to take a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.

improvement_complement: Improvements providing benefits when other players build rooms or enhance your own room building.
text: Each time after another player builds 1 or more rooms, you can give them 1 food to build exactly 1 room yourself. (You must pay the building cost of the room.)

improvement_complement: Improvements providing benefits when other players build rooms or enhance your own room building.
text: Each time after another player builds 1 or more rooms, you can give them 1 food to build exactly 1 room yourself. (You must pay the building cost of the room.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance the benefits of using the "Major Improvement" action space or that offer cost-effective renovation opportunities.
text: Each time after you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you can take a "renovation" action, paying 2 clay or 2 stone less for the renovation.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for other players' actions on the "Reed Bank" accumulation space or that enhance room construction cost efficiency.
text: Each time another player uses the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can build a room: if you build a clay/stone room, you get a discount of 1 clay/2 stone.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that reduce the wood cost of rooms or that offer benefits for constructing wood rooms during specific rounds.
text: Wood rooms now cost you 1 reed, and additionally 5 wood through round 5, 4 wood in rounds 6 and 7, and 3 wood in round 8 and later.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that reduce the wood cost of rooms or that offer benefits for constructing wood rooms during specific rounds.
text: Wood rooms now cost you 1 reed, and additionally 5 wood through round 5, 4 wood in rounds 6 and 7, and 3 wood in round 8 and later.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for wood management or that enhance stable and room construction based on wood availability.
text: Each harvest in which you have at least 5 wood in your supply, you can discard down to 5 wood to take a "Build Stables" or "Build Wood Rooms" action by paying the usual costs.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific late-round action spaces or that enhance action space availability.
text: You can use the action space on round space 13 even if it is occupied by one or more people of the players to your immediate left and right.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Urgent Wish for Children" action space or that enhance family growth opportunities.
text: You can use the "Urgent Wish for Children" action space (from round 12-13) even if it is occupied by the first person another player placed.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of using the "Farm Expansion" or "Grain Seeds" action spaces or that offer additional action opportunities based on specific conditions.
text: Immediately after each time you use the "Farm Expansion" or "Grain Seeds" action space, you can use the respective other space with the same person (even if it is occupied).

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the "Grain Utilization" or "Fencing" action spaces or that enhance resource management based on action space occupancy.
text: Each time after you use the "Grain Utilization" or "Fencing" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use the other space with the same person.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for repeated use of action spaces or that enhance action space selection flexibility.
text: Once per round, when placing a person after your first two, you can place it on the action space with your 2nd person and use that space again. (Mark the action space).

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that leverage reed management or that enhance the benefits of using specific accumulation spaces.
text: Each time you use the "Grove" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you can place 2 reed from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for not using the "Meeting Place" action space or that enhance room construction without placing a person.
text: At the end of each work phase in which you did not use the "Meeting Place" action space, you can take a "Build Rooms" action without placing a person.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for building specific major improvements or that enhance occupation play.
text: Each time after you build the major improvement "Joinery", "Pottery", and "Basketmaker's Workshop", you can play up to 2 occupations without paying an occupation cost.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer flexibility in building major improvements from the bottom row or that enhance minor improvement play.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 stone. You can build any of the major improvements in the bottom row of the supply board even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for wood accumulation or that enhance minor improvement play immediately after wood acquisition.
text: Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can play a minor improvement.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Grain Seeds" action space in combination with occupied "Lessons" action spaces or that enhance occupation play at a reduced cost.
text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space when any "Lessons" action space is occupied, you can also play an occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer bonuses for having no unused farmyard spaces or that enhance vegetable harvest benefits.
text: Once you have no unused farmyard spaces left, you get 1 bonus point for each vegetable that you harvest.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for other players' "Sow" actions or that enhance point scoring based on giving resources to other players.
text: Each time before another player takes an unconditional "Sow" action, you can give them 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for renovating to stone or that enhance point scoring based on resource management.
text: When you renovate to stone, you can place up to 1 wood from your supply in each of your rooms. During scoring, each such wood is worth 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for resource conversion during the feeding phase or that enhance point and food production.
text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn 1 wood plus 1 grain into 1 bonus point and 2 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on resource pairs or that enhance resource management for scoring purposes.
text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each stone-wood pair in your supply. You cannot score additional points for the resources scored with this card.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits based on the balance of major improvements, minor improvements, and occupations or that enhance vegetable acquisition.
text: At the start of scoring, you get a number of vegetables equal to the smallest of the numbers of major improvements, minor improvements, and occupations you have.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on cattle management or that enhance cattle acquisition.
text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each space in your farmyard (including rooms) holding at least 1 cattle.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on pasture management or that enhance pasture and animal management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 clay. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each pasture you have holding the maximum number of animals.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer immediate bonuses for early stone renovation or that enhance food and point acquisition based on renovation timing.
text: After playing this card, if you renovate to stone in round 13/12/11 or before, you immediately get 1/2/3 food and 1/2/3 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Improvements that provide bonus points for using "Fishing" or enhance benefits when others use this action space.
text: Each time the "Fishing" accumulation space is used, you get 1 bonus point and must skip placing your next person that round. (You can place the person on a later turn.)

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on animal diversity or that enhance animal acquisition and management.
text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with 2+/3+/4+ animals of each type gets 1/3/5 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer bonuses for wood acquisition or that enhance vegetable acquisition based on competition.
text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most vegetables in their fields gets 2 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for diverse resource conversion into food and points or that enhance resource management based on specific sets.
text: At the start of each round, you can exchange a set comprised of 1 animal of any type, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable for 5 food and 2 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer bonuses for fenced stable management or that enhance point scoring based on stable capacity.
text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most fenced stables gets 2 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on building resource diversity or that enhance resource acquisition based on building actions.
text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with 1+/2+/3+ building resources of each type gets 1/3/5 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on pasture capacity or that enhance pasture management.
text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with a pasture of highest capacity gets 3 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that enhance the benefits of using the "Sheep Market" or "Reed Bank" accumulation spaces or that offer additional resource management benefits.
text: Each time you use the "Sheep Market" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can also take 1 good from the respective other accumulation space, if possible.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer cost-effective goods acquisition after using "Lesson" action spaces or that enhance resource management based on specific conditions.
text: Each time after you use a "Lesson" action space, you can buy up to 2 different goods: grain, stone, sheep, and wild boar for 1 food each; cattle and vegetable for 2 food each.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits based on the use of specific mid-round action spaces or that enhance resource acquisition based on round placement.
text: Place 1 vegetable, 1 wild boar, 1 stone, and 1 cattle on this card. Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get the corresponding good from this card.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Day Laborer" action space or that enhance animal acquisition and conversion.
text: On the "Day Laborer" action space, you also get your choice of 1 sheep or 1 grain. Instead of that good, you can buy 1 wild boar for 1 food or 1 cattle for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for wood management or that enhance food acquisition based on other players' actions.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. Each time before another player takes at least 5 wood from an accumulation space, they must first pay you 1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the "Fishing" accumulation space or that enhance food and reed management based on specific costs.
text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space you can also pay 1 wood to get 1 food for each person you have, and 1 reed
Each time you use an accumulation space providing exactly 1 animal, you can leave it on the space and get one from the general supply instead, as well as 3 food and 1 grain.
Each time you use an accumulation space providing exactly 1 animal, you can leave it on the space and get one from the general supply instead, as well as 3 food and 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that leverage reed conversion into food or that enhance resource management based on reed availability.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 reed and 1 food. At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 2 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using or influencing the use of the "Meeting Place" action space or that enhance food acquisition based on social interactions.
text: Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, both they and you get 1 food (before taking the actions). If you use it, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for wood scarcity or that enhance food acquisition based on game board conditions.
text: In the returning home phase of each round, if there is no wood left on the game board, you get 1 food—from round 5 on, even 2 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer immediate major improvement actions or that enhance benefits for using the "Hollow" accumulation space.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get a "Major Improvement" action to build a Fireplace. Each time you use the "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for placing goods on farmyard spaces or that enhance food acquisition based on farm management actions.
text: At the end of each work phase in which you placed at least 1 good on 1 of your farmyard spaces, you get 2 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for large accumulation space use or that enhance food acquisition based on specific actions.
text: Each time you take at least 4 building resources or 4 animals from an accumulation space, you also get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer alternatives for "Minor Improvement" actions or that enhance bread baking benefits.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. Each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Bake Bread" action instead.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation spaces or that enhance clay and food management.
text: Each time you use the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get a number of food equal to the amount of clay on the respective other accumulation space.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer cost-effective grain acquisition or that act as additional fields with unique purchase options.
text: When you play this card, you can immediately exchange 0/1/3 clay for 1/2/3 grain. This card is a field.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Sheep Market" accumulation space or that enhance grain acquisition based on others' actions.
text: Each time any player (including you) uses the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, you get 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for specific action space occupancy conditions or that enhance vegetable acquisition.
text: At the start of the returning home phase of each round, if both the "Day Laborer" and "Grain Seeds" action spaces are occupied, you get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for reed management or that enhance grain and vegetable acquisition based on others' actions.
text: Each time any player (including you) takes at least 2 reed from the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can choose to take 1 grain or buy 1 vegetable for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces or that enhance vegetable acquisition based on spatial conditions.
text: At the end of each work phase in which you occupy the "Clay Pit" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space while the respective other is unoccupied, you get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' use of the "Hollow" accumulation space or that enhance clay and food acquisition.
text: Each time another player uses the "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 clay. In a 3-/4-player game, you also get 1 additional clay/food.

improvement_complement: Wood acquisition enhancements or those providing wood bonuses when receiving large amounts of non-wood items.
text: Each time you use an accumulation space providing at least 3 goods of the same type except wood, you get an additional 1 wood. (Food is also considered a good.)

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces or that enhance wood and reed management.
text: Each time after you use the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 wood. On "Clay Pit" you also get 1 additional reed.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for others' renovation actions or that enhance reed acquisition based on specific conditions.
text: Each time another player renovates, you immediately get 1 reed from the general supply. When you play this card in a 3-player game, you immediately get 1 reed.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for achieving specific farm configurations or that enhance clay and reed acquisition based on others' actions.
text: Place 3 reed and 4 clay on this card. The next player to have 3 pastures/5 field tiles get the 3 reed/4 clay (not retroactively).

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, particularly reed, when using specific action spaces or their neighbors.
text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space or one of the three orthogonally adjacent actions spaces, you get 1 additional reed.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements, particularly reed, when using specific action spaces or their neighbors.
text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space or one of the three orthogonally adjacent action spaces, you get 1 additional reed.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Grove" or "Forest" accumulation spaces or that enhance reed acquisition based on spatial conditions.
text: Each time after any player (including you) uses the unoccupied "Grove" or "Forest" accumulation space while the other of the two is occupied, you get 1 reed.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer immediate reed acquisition based on major improvement count or that enhance reed management.
text: When you play this card, if you have 1/2/3/4 major improvements, you immediately get 2/3/4/5 reed.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer end-of-harvest reed acquisition or that enhance resource management based on harvest timing.
text: At the end of each harvest, you get 1 reed from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using building resource accumulation spaces or that enhance resource acquisition based on card discarding.
text: Each time you use a building resource accumulation space, you can discard exactly 1 card from your hand to get 1 additional building resource of the accumulating type.

improvement_complement: Bulk resource acquisition improvements or those providing bonuses for taking large amounts of resources.
text: Each time you take at least 4 of the same building resource from an accumulation space, you get 1additional building resource of the accumulating type and 1 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for taking food from specific accumulation spaces or that enhance building resource acquisition based on food taken.
text: Each time you take exactly 2/3/4/5 food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 stone/reed/clay/wood. (If you take 6 or more food, you do not get a bonus good).

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for others' renovation actions or that enhance resource acquisition based on major improvement construction.
text: Place a unique pair of different building resources on each of your improvements. Each time another player renovates, you may move one such pair to your supply.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using wood accumulation spaces or that enhance wild boar acquisition based on specific costs.
text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to get 1 wild boar.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using the "Day Laborer" action space or that enhance round-based good acquisition.
text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, place 1 food, 1 food, and 1 wild boar on the next 3 round spaces, respectively. At the start of these rounds, you get the good.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer unique animal housing options or that enhance sheep management based on room adjacency.
text: You can keep 2 sheep on the border between each pair of orthogonally adjacent rooms.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer unique animal housing options or that enhance sheep management based on room adjacency.
text: You can keep 2 sheep on the border between each pair of orthogonally adjacent rooms.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that leverage clay management or that enhance wild boar acquisition based on specific conversion conditions.
text: Each time you use an accumulation space, place 1 clay from the general supply on this card. You must immediately exchange 4 clay on this card for 1 wild boar, held by this card.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for sheep management or that enhance animal housing based on occupation cards.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 sheep. You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation in front of you.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that enhance sheep management or that offer benefits based on the number of completed feeding phases.
text: This card can hold a number of sheep equal to the number of completed feeding phases.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' use of the "Quarry" accumulation space or that enhance stable construction without wood cost.
text: Each time another player uses a "Quarry" accumulation space, you can choose to get 1 food or build a stable without paying wood.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Traveling Players" accumulation space or that enhance room construction at a reduced reed cost.
text: Each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you also get a "Build Rooms" action. Each room you build during the action costs you 1 reed less.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for stable removal or that enhance pasture management through unique construction options.
text: When you play this card, you remove exactly 3 stables in your supply from play to build a pasture covering 2 farmyard spaces. You only need to pay a total of 2 wood for fences

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer immediate animal acquisition based on the number of remaining harvests or that enhance food and wild boar management.
text: When you play this card, pay 1 food for each remaining harvest to immediately get 1 cattle and 1 wild boar.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' renovation to stone or that enhance room construction cost efficiency for clay houses.
text: Each time another player renovates to stone, if you live in a clay house, you can pay 2 food to build a clay room at no additional cost.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Family Growth" action space with specific timing or that enhance action efficiency based on family expansion.
text: Each time you take a "Family Growth" action with the second person you place in a round, return the first person you placed home.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the "Farm Expansion" or "Major Improvement" action spaces or that enhance action space flexibility based on specific conditions.
text: Each time after you use the "Farm Expansion" or "Major Improvement" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use that other space with the same person.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for mirroring others' action space use or that enhance resource management based on specific costs.
text: On your turn, if you pay 1 grain to the general supply, you can use the same action space that the player to your right has just used on their turn.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' use of the "Traveling Players" accumulation space or that enhance construction action flexibility.
text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can take your choice of a "Build Fences", "Build Stables", or "Build Rooms" action.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for living in a specific type of house or that enhance action space availability based on house size.
text: You immediately get 1 stone. As long as you live in a wooden house with exactly 2 rooms, actions spaces—excluding Meeting Place—are not considered occupied for you.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for late-round action space use or that enhance action space availability based on specific conditions.
text: At the start of each returning home phase, if only one action space card on round space 1 to 4 is unoccupied, you can use that action space.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for grain utilization actions taken by others or that enhance "Sow" action opportunities.
text: Each time after another player uses the "Grain Utilization" action space, you get a "Sow" action.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Traveling Players" accumulation space or that enhance action space selection flexibility based on social interactions.
text: Immediately after each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can place another person on an action space of your choice, regardless whether or not the action space is occupied.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Day Laborer" action space or that enhance occupation and minor improvement play flexibility.
text: Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 1 food to use an unoccupied "Traveling Players" or "Lessons" action space with the same person.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for occupation play in the absence of "Lessons" action space use or that enhance occupation cost efficiency.
text: Each returning home phase in which no player returns a person from a "Lessons" action space, you can play an occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on major improvement valuation or that enhance major improvement point contribution.
text: During scoring, total the point values of your major improvements. The smallest value counts double. If the total is at least 5/7/9/11, you get 1/2/3/4 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Resource exchange improvements or those that provide bonuses when other players renovate.
text: Each time another player renovates, you can exchange exactly 2 wood for 1 grain, 1 food, and 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on wild boar management or that enhance animal diversity benefits.
text: The first time after you play this card that you have 5 wild boars on your farm, you immediately get 3 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on grain field management or that enhance crop production benefits.
text: At the start of each of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, if you have at least 1/2/3/4/5/6 grain fields, you get 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for stone renovation cost efficiency or that enhance point scoring based on others' housing types.
text: Renovating to stone costs you 2 stone less. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each other player living in a stone house.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for stone renovation cost efficiency or that enhance point scoring based on others' housing types.
text: Renovating to stone costs you 2 stone less. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each other player living in a stone house.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on others' use of food accumulation spaces or that enhance resource giving benefits.
text: Each time another player uses a food accumulation space, you can give them 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer point scoring opportunities based on sheep management or that enhance sheep and food acquisition based on specific conditions.
text: You can only play this card if you have less than 7 sheep. Once this game, when you have 7 sheep on your farm, you immediately get 3 bonus points and 2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer point buying opportunities based on accumulation space use or that enhance resource management based on specific conditions.
text: Each time you use one of the two accumulation spaces for the same type of good containing exactly the same number of goods, you can also buy 1 bonus point for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for occupation cost payment or that enhance resource management based on social space use.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you pay an occupation cost, you can use food from the "traveling Players" accumulation space.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for wood conversion into food and grain or that enhance resource management based on harvest actions.
text: Each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood into 1 food and 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer immediate food and grain acquisition based on occupation play or that enhance resource distribution based on action space occupancy.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain and, at the start of this returning home phase, an amount of food equal to the number of occupied action space cards.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for acquiring goods from others' actions or that enhance resource management based on specific accumulation spaces.
text: Each time another player uses a reed, stone, sheep, or wild boar accumulation space, you can pay them 1 food to get 1 good of the respective type from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for cattle market management or that enhance grain and food acquisition based on cattle availability.
text: Immediately add 1 cattle from the general supply to the "Cattle Market" accumulation space. Afterward, you get 1 grain plus 1 food for each cattle on "Cattle Market".

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using the "Resource Market" action space or that enhance resource and food acquisition based on specific conditions.
text: Place 3 grain and 3 food on this card. Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space, you also get 1 grain and 1 food from this card.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for lesson action space availability or that enhance food acquisition based on specific educational conditions.
text: At the start of each returning home phase, if at least one "Lessons" action space is unoccupied, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer immediate food bonuses or point scoring opportunities based on family size relative to others.
text: As soon as the next player but you gains their 5th person, you immediately get 8 food (not retroactively). During scoring, if only you have 5 people, you get 3 bonus points.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for having a surplus of building resources or that enhance food acquisition based on resource competition.
text: Before the start of each round, if you have more building resources than all other players of at least two types, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for animal conversion into food or that enhance food acquisition based on specific conversion actions.
text: At any time, you can pay 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from you farm. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 3/5/7 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for early-round actions or that enhance food acquisition based on specific accumulation space use.
text: Each time you use an action space on round spaces 1 to 8, place 1 food on this card. Each time this cards has 3 food on it, move the food to your supply.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for resource conversion into food or that enhance food production based on others' social space use.
text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can exchange your choice of 1 grain/sheep/vegetable for 4/5/7 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using specific wood and reed accumulation spaces or that enhance food acquisition based on spatial conditions.
text: At the end of each work phase, if you used both the "Forest" and "Grove" accumulation spaces, you get 5 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for wood scarcity or that enhance food acquisition based on accumulation space conditions.
text: Each time before you place a person, if there are at least 8 wood total on accumulation spaces, you get 1 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits based on food accumulation space comparison or that enhance food acquisition based on specific scarcity conditions.
text: At the start of each round, if there is more food on the "Traveling Players" than on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get the difference from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for giving resources to others or that enhance food acquisition based on specific accumulation space interactions.
text: Each time another player uses the "Fishing"/"Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can give them 1 wood to get 2 food/3 food from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for others' field tile placement or that enhance food and grain acquisition based on field expansion actions.
text: For each field tile that another player places next to an existing field tile, you get 1 food from the general supply. In round 14, you get 1 grain instead.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for reed conversion into food or that enhance resource trading flexibility based on others' interest.
text: At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 3 food. Any other player can prevent this by buying the reed for 2 food from you. If multiple players are interested, choose one.

improvement_complement: Improvements that offer benefits for using "Traveling Players" or allow for the conversion of sheep to vegetables.
text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you get 1 food and 1 wood. Immediately after, you can buy exactly 1 vegetable for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for specific accumulation space occupancy or that enhance grain acquisition based on spatial conditions.
text: Immediately, when you play this card, and at the end of each work phase, in which the "Forest", "Clay Pit", and "Reed Bank" accumulation spaces are all occupied, you get 1 grain.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for vegetable acquisition based on others' renovation and improvement actions or that enhance resource conversion efficiency.
text: Each time any player (including you) renovates and the builds no/ 1 minor/ 1 major improvement, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3/2/1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for repeated accumulation space use or that enhance vegetable acquisition based on action repetition.
text: Each time you use an accumulation space while already having used another accumulation space for the same type of good that work phase, you also get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer immediate vegetable acquisition based on field tile conditions or that enhance crop production efficiency.
text: When you play this card, if you have at least 2/4/5 unplanted field tiles, you immediately get 1/2/3 vegetables.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for not using high-value accumulation spaces or that enhance vegetable acquisition based on specific avoidance actions.
text: Each time it is your turn in the work phase, if there are one or more accumulation spaces with 5+ goods on them and you do not use any of them, you get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for specific wood accumulation conditions or that enhance wood and food management based on acquisition quantity.
text: Each time you obtain exactly 2/3/4 wood from a wood accumulation space, you get 1 additional wood and 1/0/1 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer shared benefits for wood accumulation space use or that enhance wood acquisition for both you and others.
text: This card is an action space for all. If another player uses it, they get 3 wood and must give you 1 wood from the general supply. If you use it, you get 4 wood.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for spatial accumulation space interactions or that enhance wood and clay management based on others' actions.
text: Each time both the "Forest" and "Clay Pit" accumulation spaces are occupied, you can use the gap between them as an action space to get 2 clay and 3 wood.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Resource Market" action space with specific timing or that enhance building resource acquisition based on action order.
text: Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space with the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th person you place, you also get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone/stone.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer immediate stone acquisition based on others' construction actions or that enhance stone management.
text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 stone. Each time another player renovates to stone or builds a stone room, you get 1 stone.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for high-quantity good acquisition actions or that enhance building resource acquisition based on others' accumulation space use.
text: Each time any player (including you) takes 5/6/7/8+ goods from an accumulation space, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for pig market actions or that enhance sheep acquisition based on others' actions.
text: Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you get 1 sheep from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for animal accumulation space use without house occupancy or that enhance sheep acquisition based on specific conditions.
text: Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if afterward you have no animal in your house, you also get 1 sheep.

improvement_complement: Improvements that exchange food for wood following any action or provide bonuses for resource trades.
text: Each time you take wood from an accumulation space, you can exchange 1 wood for 1 sheep. Place the wood on the accumulation space.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer immediate animal acquisition based on the number of remaining harvests or that enhance food and wild boar management.
text: When you play this card, pay 1 food for each remaining harvest to immediately get 1 cattle and 1 wild boar.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for grain discarding actions before harvest or that enhance wild boar acquisition based on crop management.
text: Immediately before each harvest, you can discard 1/3/4 grain from different fields to get 1/2/3 wild boars.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using animal accumulation spaces in combination with specific action space adjacency or that enhance wild boar acquisition based on spatial strategy.
text: Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if you occupy either the action space immediately above or below that accumulation space, you also get 1 wild boar.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "Grain Seeds" action space or that enhance cattle acquisition based on specific costs.
text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you can also buy 1 cattle for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for cattle acquisition based on pasture count or that enhance food conversion efficiency for animal purchase.
text: Immediately before each harvest, you can buy 1 cattle for 4 food minus 1 food for each pasture you have. (The minimum cost is 0).

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for stable construction actions or that enhance cattle acquisition based on construction quantity.
text: Each time you build at least 2 stables on the same turn, you also get 1 cattle.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for simultaneous room and stable construction actions or that enhance animal acquisition based on construction diversity.
text: Each time you build at least 1 wood/clay/stone room and at least 1 stable on the same turn, you also get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' fencing actions or that enhance animal acquisition based on specific construction actions.
text: Each time another player uses the "Fencing" action space, you can buy exactly 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from the general supply for 1/2/2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for animal breeding outside of the breeding phase or that enhance animal diversity management.
text: You immediately get 1 wood. After each round that does not end with a harvest, you can breed exactly one type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer immediate mixed animal acquisition based on housing capacity or that enhance animal management based on specific acquisition conditions.
text: When you play this card, you can pay 2 food to get 1 sheep, 1 wild boar, and 1 cattle, but only if you can accommodate all three animals on your farm.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using the "Day Laborer" action space or that enhance diverse animal acquisition and conversion.
text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, instead of 2 food, you can get 3 different animals from the general supply. If you do, you must pay 1 food each harvest left to play.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for occupation play following "Lessons" action space use or that enhance animal acquisition at a reduced cost.
text: Immediately after each time you use a "Lessons" action space, you can also buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 0/1/2 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for renovation actions or that enhance animal and food acquisition based on pasture and stable management.
text: Each time you renovate, you get 2 food and 1 additional animal of the respective type in each of your pastures with stable.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for immediate renovation actions following clay or stone accumulation space use or that enhance cost efficiency for house upgrading.
text: Immediately after each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can renovate your house to clay/stone without paying reed.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for managing a variety of animals based on others' major improvement construction or that enhance animal housing capacity.
text: For each major improvement built by the other players, you can keep 1 animal on this card (max. 8). You can keep different types here.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer permanent housing benefits based on major improvement construction cost or that enhance point scoring based on complete farmyard utilization.
text: Once the total printed building cost of all the major improvements you have is at least 9 building resources, this card provides room for 1 person for the rest of the game.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for wood accumulation actions taken by others or that enhance field plowing efficiency based on specific costs.
text: Each time another player takes at least 4 wood from an accumulation space, you can immediately pay 1 food to plow 1 field.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for initial pasture creation without wood cost or that enhance fencing efficiency for players without pastures.
text: When you play this card, if you have no pastures yet, you can immediately fence exactly 1 space in your farmyard without paying wood for the fences.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer immediate fencing benefits following the appearance of specific action space cards or that enhance pasture creation efficiency based on game timing.
text: When the "Pig Market" and "Cattle Market" action space cards are each revealed (and placed on the round space), you can immediately fence exactly 1 farmyard space without playing wood.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer shared benefits for fencing actions or that enhance sheep acquisition based on specific construction actions.
text: This card is an action space for all. It provides a "Build Fences" action and then 1 sheep. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for fence building flexibility or that enhance construction efficiency without action space use.
text: You can build fences at any time without placing a person. (This is not considered a "Build Fences" action.)

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer unique action space availability for fencing, house redevelopment, or vegetable seeds or that enhance construction and planting flexibility based on existing action spaces.
text: This is an action space for you only. It provides a choice of "Fencing", "House Redevelopment", or "Vegetable Seeds" if the corresponding action space is already in play.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for food acquisition following others' "Lessons" action space use or that enhance educational action space efficiency.
text: Each time another player pays food on a "Lessons" action space, you get exactly 1 of that food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for adjacent action space use or that enhance action selection flexibility based on spatial strategy.
text: Immediately after each time you place a person on an action space card, you can pay 1 food to place another person on the card immediately left to it (and so on).

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Day Laborer" action space or that enhance minor improvement play flexibility based on specific costs.
text: In the returning home phase of each round, you can pay 1 food to either take a "Minor Improvement" action or to draw 2 new minor improvements.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for specific accumulation space occupancy or that enhance resource acquisition based on spatial conditions.
text: At the end of each work phase, if both the "Fishing" and "Traveling Players" accumulation spaces are occupied, you get your choice of 1 grain or 2 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for cattle management based on other players' cattle count or that enhance food acquisition based on cattle diversity.
text: At the start of each round, if 3/4/5+ players each have at least 1 cattle, you get 1/2/3 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for others' field plowing actions or that enhance food acquisition based on field expansion strategy.
text: Each time another player plows a field, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for reed conversion into food or that enhance resource management based on specific conversion actions.
text: At any time, you can exchange 1 reed for 2 food.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer immediate clay acquisition benefits based on specific round timing or that enhance resource theft efficiency.
text: Once this game, at the start of a work phase of your choice, you can turn this card face down to get all of the clay on the "Hollow" action space.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific action spaces with the (meeple) symbol or that enhance food acquisition based on action selection strategy.
text: Each time you use an action space with the (meeple) symbol, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using the "House Building" action space or that enhance food acquisition based on social space use.
text: Each time the "House Building" action space on the game board extension is used, you get all of the food from the "Traveling Players" accumulation space.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for food acquisition following major improvement construction by others or that enhance resource distribution based on construction activity.
text: Each time a major improvement is built, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the "Clay Pit" accumulation space or that enhance vegetable acquisition at a reduced cost.
text: Each time you use the "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can also buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for pre-action space use on the game board extension or that enhance vegetable acquisition efficiency based on specific costs.
text: Immediately before each time you place a person on an action space with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension, you can buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using specific accumulation spaces on the game board extension or that enhance vegetable acquisition based on spatial strategy.
text: Each time you use the "Riverbank Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 vegetable.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for building resource management or that enhance crop acquisition based on accumulation space conditions.
text: At the end of each work phase, if 1 stone accumulation space has stone left, you get 1 grain If 2 stone accumulation spaces have stone left, you get 1 vegetable instead.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for crop management based on others' harvest actions or that enhance food and vegetable acquisition based on collective farming efficiency.
text: Each time the other players harvest grain from at least 3/4/6 fields combined, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for clay acquisition based on specific accumulation space use or that enhance crop management efficiency based on clay and vegetable availability.
text: Each time you take at least 3 clay from the "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain. If you take at least 6 clay from it, you also get 1 vegetable (instead of grain).

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for educational action space use or that enhance food, grain, and vegetable acquisition based on teaching efficiency.
text: Immediately after each time you use a "Lessons" action space, if this is the 1st/2nd/3rd occupied Lessons action space that round, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using specific farming action spaces or that enhance clay acquisition based on agricultural actions.
text: Each time you use the "Farmland", "Cultivation", or "Farming Supplies" action (the latter only being available with 6 players), you also get 2 clay.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for others' use of the "Meeting Place" action space or that enhance wood and food acquisition based on social space interactions.
text: The Village Idiot is your lone occupation. Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, you get 1 wood and 1 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer immediate wood acquisition benefits based on existing occupation count and wood management or that enhance wood stockpiling efficiency.
text: When you play this card, if you have another occupation in play and more wood than all other players combined, you immediately get wood from the general supply until you have 15 wood.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for wood accumulation actions or that enhance clay acquisition based on specific wood management conditions.
text: In the work phase of each round, the first and the second time you use a wood accumulation space, you also get 1 and 2 clay respectively.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer immediate stone and reed acquisition benefits based on specific costs or that enhance resource management efficiency.
text: When you play this card you immediately pay 1 food. If you do, you get 2 stone and 2 reed.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for using the game board extension or that enhance building resource acquisition based on specific action space interactions.
text: Place 1 stone and 1 food on all action spaces with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension. Next time you place a person on them, you get the goods.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using the game board extension or that enhance stone acquisition efficiency based on specific costs.
text: Immediately after each time you use an accumulation space on the game board extension, you can buy 1 stone for 1 food.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for field plowing actions or that enhance stone acquisition efficiency based on agricultural actions.
text: Each time you plow at least 1 field, you also get 1 stone.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for wood acquisition following others' room construction actions or that enhance resource management based on construction activity.
text: Each time another player builds a room, you immediately get 1 wood.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for building resource acquisition at the start of each harvest or that enhance resource diversity management.
text: At the start of each harvest, you get 1 building resource of your choice.
