improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for educational action space use or that enhance building resource and crop acquisition based on specific educational conditions.
text: Each time all three "Lessons" action spaces are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get your choice of 1 building resource or 1 crop of each type.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for following others' "Resource Market" action space use or that enhance action selection efficiency based on specific interactions.
text: Immediately after each time another player uses the "Resource Market" action space, you can also place a person there to take the action as well.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for pasture creation actions or that enhance cattle acquisition based on spatial construction strategies.
text: Each time you create at least one new pasture from unfenced farmyard spaces you get 1 cattle.

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer immediate cattle and food acquisition benefits based on specific round conditions or that enhance animal management efficiency.
text: When both action spaces on round spaces 3 and 6 are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get 1 cattle and 2 food.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for using specific quarry spaces or that enhance sheep acquisition efficiency based on resource management strategies.
text: Each time you use either "Quarry" accumulation space, you immediately get an additional 1 sheep from the general supply.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for wood accumulation space use or that enhance wild boar acquisition efficiency based on wood management conditions.
text: In the returning home phase of each round, if at least 3 wood accumulation spaces are occupied, you can pay 1 wood to get 1 wild boar.

improvement_complement: Consider improvements that offer benefits for using the "Animal Market" action space or that enhance animal acquisition efficiency based on specific market conditions.
text: Each time you use the "Animal Market" action space, you can pay 1 food to use the same option twice (instead of once).

improvement_complement: Focus on improvements that offer benefits for food accumulation space use or that enhance animal acquisition efficiency based on specific food management conditions.
text: Each time you take 1/2/3 food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 cattle/wild boar/sheep.

improvement_complement: Look for improvements that offer benefits for leaving goods on accumulation spaces or that enhance sheep, wild boar, and cattle acquisition efficiency based on specific accumulation space strategies.
text: Each time you use an accumulation space with exactly 2/4/6 goods on it, you can leave 1/2/3 goods on the space. If you do, you get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.

improvement_complement: Seek out improvements that offer benefits for using wood accumulation spaces or that enhance animal acquisition efficiency based on specific wood management conditions.
text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, if this is the 2nd/3rd/4th occupied wood accumulation space that round, you can buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 1 food.
Once you live in a Clay hut or Stone house, whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood you can pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.
Once all the Family members have been placed in this round, you may place a Guest marker to carry out an additional Action.
During the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can use the Brewer's Copper to convert at most 1 Grain to 2 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point if you have at least 7 Grain.
The Bust cannot be carved (this card can not be played) once all other players have 2 or more Occupations. (3 Occupations in a 3-player game, 4 Occupations in a 2-player game).
Pay 2 Food for each of your Family members, and receive 4 Bonus points. (Write them on the scoring pad).
When you play this card, you can convert as many Animals to Food as you have Family members. For each Sheep, you receive 3 Food, for each Wild boar, 4 and for each Cattle, 5.

Three times during the game (at most once per round), you can place 1 Vegetable on this card and receive 3 Food in exchange. The Vegetable(s) on this card are counted in the scoring at the end of the game.

Play this card before the end of Round 4. When you play this card, place one of your unbuilt fences upright on an unused farmyard space. If you have not knocked it over by the end of the game, you earn 2 Bonus points. (The farmyard space counts as "used".) (If another player knocks it over, you can replace it)
For each Round that has not yet begun when you play this card, you receive 1 Bonus point and 2 Food. (Write the Bonus point(s) on the scoring pad.)

As long as you have at least 1 Cattle in your farm, you can knock down your fences and rebuild them at any time, for no cost. (Your animals do not run away.) (Fences must always be placed according to the rules.)

Place 1 Vegetable from your own supply on this card. At any time, you can Harvest this Vegetable and convert it to Food. If it is still on the card at the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points. (You can count the Vegetable in scoring at the end of the game.)
Whenever you Sow, you can pay 1 Wood and Sow 2 Grain instead of 1 on an empty field.

improvement_complement: Family growth efficiency improvements or those reducing the food cost for unconventional family growth actions.
text: At any time, you can play 3 Food to take a "Family growth" action without placing one of your Family members. You must have room in your home. You can use the Newborn to take action from the following round.

improvement_complement: Food acquisition improvements, especially those providing bonuses for strategic placement of family members.
text: Whenever you manage to be the very last player to place a Family member in any round, you receive 1 Food after you take the final action. If you play the Gentleman card with the last Family member to be placed during the current round, you receive 2 Food.

improvement_complement: Round card manipulation improvements or those providing wood acquisition benefits upon card play.
text: At any time, you may look at all the remaining unplaced Round cards and re-sort them. (Cards must remain in the appropriate game stage.) When you play this card, you receive 2 Wood.

improvement_complement: Food production enhancements or improvements providing bonuses for actions resulting in high food acquisition.
text: Whenever you or another player receives more than 2 Food from an Action space, you receive 1 Food from the General supply.

improvement_complement: Action space utilization improvements or those imposing restrictions on goods collection for other players.
text: From now until the end of the game, the other players only receive goods from Action spaces when they return their Family members to their home. (This card applies to goods that are on Action spaces as well as goods that are taken from the Supply, but not to goods that are received from cards.)

improvement_complement: Animal conversion enhancements or improvements providing end-game scoring bonuses for stored animals.
text: When you convert Animals to Food, you can place (some of) them on this card instead of returning them to the Supply. The card can hold a maximum of 1 Sheep, 1 Wild boar and 1 Cattle. These animals are counted in scoring.

improvement_complement: Vegetable sowing improvements or those providing immediate sowing options for vegetables acquired outside Harvest.
text: You may immediately Sow each Vegetable that you receive outside the Harvest phase and would otherwise place in your Supply.

improvement_complement: Resource acquisition improvements or those providing options to purchase grain and vegetables at reduced costs.
text: Place 2 Grain and 2 Vegetables on this card. You may buy them at any time. Each Grain costs 2 Food, each Vegetable costs 3 Food.

improvement_complement: Resource to food and bonus point conversion improvements or those providing flexible exchange options.
text: You can exchange 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Stone for 2 Food and 1 Bonus point at any time and as often as you like. (Note the Bonus points in the appropriate section of the scoring pad.)

improvement_complement: Food acquisition improvements or those providing immediate benefits upon occupation play.
text: You receive 4 Food before you pay the costs of playing this Occupation. Immediately return this card to your hand.

improvement_complement: Bonus point acquisition improvements or those providing options to exchange wood and food for points.
text: During the Field phase of each Harvest, you can exchange 1 Wood and 1 Food for 1 Bonus point. (Note the Bonus points in the appropriate section of the scoring pad.)

improvement_complement: Family growth efficiency improvements or those reducing the food cost for bringing in multiple family members.
text: When you have Family growth, you can pay 3 Food to bring 2 new Family members instead of 1 into the game. You need only have space for 1 Family member in your home.
